Shrine of Oaths.name: 誓言之殿
Shrine of Oaths.description:
誓言之殿是一本融合黑暗奇幻、悬疑解谜与地城探索的基于DND 5 版规则设计的一次性冒险模组，适配 3-4 级角色。该冒险预计 3-4 小时的冒险特别适合钟爱萦绕不散的诡谲氛围与发掘失落史诗的玩家群体。

这座被遗忘的神殿曾是神圣禁地，多年前被永久封印。那些立誓守护此地之人——即便死后依然徘徊的灵体——仍在履行着不朽的守望誓约。

近期一场塌方意外暴露了神殿入口，冒险小队受托寻找埃米尔·科维安爵士，这位受命调查神殿的骑士与其部下已全员失联。当尘封的殿堂重见天日，等待探索者的不仅是古老的秘密，更是对勇气、荣耀乃至命运本身的终极考验。
Shrine of Oaths.caption: 誓言之殿遭遇

Ethereal Sight.name: 以太视界
Ethereal Sight.description: [[lookup @name uperrcase]] 在物质位面时可以看见身边 60 尺 以太位面的景色，在以太位面时可以看见身边 60 尺内物质位面的景色。

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description:
[[lookup @name uperrcase]] 可以如同穿过困难地形一样穿过其他生物和物件。

如果它在自己的回合结束时仍处在物件内部则受到5（1d10）点力场伤害。

[[lookup @name uperrcase]] 可以如同穿过困难地形一样穿过其他生物和物件。

Etherealness.name: 以太化
Etherealness.description: [[lookup @name uperrcase]] 可以在物质位面和以太位面之间转换。身处以太边境时，物质位面中也可以看到它，反之亦然。幽魂身处其中某一位面时，无法影响另一位面之物或被另一位面之物影响。

Withering Touch.name: 枯萎触击
Withering Touch.description:
枯萎触击。

近战武器攻击:命中 +5，触及 5 尺 单一目标。命中：>17 (4d6 + 3) 暗蚀伤害。

Horrifying Visage.name: 恐惧面容
Horrifying Visage.description:
幽魂周边60尺内能看见它的非不死生物必须分别进行一次DC 13 的感知豁免，豁免失败者将陷入 1 分钟的恐慌状态。若豁免失败且差值为 5 或更低，则目标还将衰老 1d4×10 年。

该受恐慌目标可以在每个其自身回合结束时重复进行一次该豁免，豁免成功则终止自身的恐慌状态，而该目标也将在未来 24 小时内免疫该幽魂的恐惧面容。该衰老效应产生后的 24 小时内，可用高等复原术抵消。

GM Note：在使用此能力前，请确保所选择的目标都是无相应状态免疫的（即那些尚未在豁免检定中成功通过的生物）。这样做可以避免将效应再次施加给已经具有免疫特性的生物。

Possession.name: 附身
Possession.description:
幽魂身边 5 尺内它可以看见的一名类人生物必须进行一次DC 13 的魅力豁免，豁免失败则被幽魂附身。附身完成后幽魂消失，目标陷入失能且身体失去控制。该幽魂接管目标身体的控制权，但不剥夺目标的意识。

该幽魂此时只能被驱散不死生物类效应指定为目标，其他任何攻击、法术或别的效应都无法将其指定为目标。此时的幽魂保留自己的阵营以及智力、感知、魅力属性，并且免疫魅惑和恐慌，其他资料则与被附身生物相同，但不能获得该目标的知识、职业特性和熟练项。

该身体的生命值降至 0 时，幽魂受驱散或被如驱逐善恶 dispel evil and good 的法术效应迫出来时，附身终止。幽魂自身也可以主动以一个附赠动作终止附身。附身终止时，幽魂重新出现在该身体周边 5 尺内一处未被占据的空间位置。目标在豁免成功或附身终止后的 24 小时里对该幽魂的附身免疫。

Sir Emil Corvian CR1.name: 埃米尔·科维安爵士 CR1
Sir Emil Corvian CR1.description:
埃米尔·科维安爵士语录

职责与荣耀：

  1. “骑士的职责不是追求荣耀，而是守护无辜者于灾厄之前。"

圣武士之道：

  1. "不必做最睿智之人，但求成为危难时最后一个倒下者。"
  2. "若提尔并不垂青于我，那我便以血汗证明之。"

箴言集：

  1. "思虑过甚反成桎梏，持守正道则万事自通。"
  2. "我虽不知万事答案，然明辨是非足矣。"
  3. "察人危难无需聪颖，但凭赤诚足矣。"

Chain Mail.name: 链甲
Chain Mail.description: 该护甲由互相锁接的金属环编成。链甲还包括在甲胄下面穿戴的一层织物衬里，用以阻止擦伤并减缓挥击的冲击。此护甲同时还附有护手。

Longsword.name: 长剑
Longsword.description: 近战攻击检定：命中 +5 ，触及 5 尺，单一目标。命中：8 (1d8 + 3) 挥砍伤害。

Shield.name: 盾牌
Shield.description: 盾牌通常由木材或金属制成，可以单手进行持用。持用一面盾牌可以令你的护甲等级 +2。不过同一时间里你只能从一面盾牌中受益。

Shortbow.name: 短弓
Shortbow.description: 这种双手握持的弓比传统的长弓要小一些，因此非常适合在行进中或骑马时进行快速攻击。

Quiver.name: 箭袋
Quiver.description: 一个箭袋可以装多达 20 支箭。

Arrow.name: 箭矢
Arrow.description: 适用于各种弓箭的标准弹药。这些普通的箭由光滑的木制箭杆、鹅毛箭羽和锤形金属箭头组成。

Shortsword.name: 短剑
Shortsword.description: 这是一把中等大小的剑，配有坚固的护手和包裹着皮革的剑柄。这是一件用途广泛的武器，它在灵活性方面弥补了距离方面的不足。

Destabilizator (Rare) v2.name: Destabilizator (Rare) v2
Destabilizator (Rare) v2.description:
Weapon (warhammer), rare (requires attunement)

"When the enemy approached, the commander raised his warhammer.

"You'll not be getting any closer, friend," he said.

The enemy charged forward, only to be knocked back.

"What was that?" he said, staggering.

"Oh, just a little something I call Distanceectomy," replied the captain. "It has a way of keeping people from getting too close."

This warhammer has a distinctive head shaped like two outstretched palms in a halting gesture with purple gemstone is embedded at its center.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This warhammer requires 16 Strength or higher to wield.

Destabilizing Attack (Passive Ability). Every time you hit with this hammer, and if the target size is Tiny, Small, Medium or Large, it must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push the target 5ft away from you and it takes [[/r 1d8]] force damage. On a successful save, the target takes only half of the force damage and is not pushed away.

Destabilizator (Uncommon) v2.description:

Helm of Open Hand v1.name: 洞明掌盔 v1
Helm of Open Hand v1.description:
奇物（头盔），珍稀（需同调）

"戴上洞明掌盔，对话局势总在意料之外骤变。"

这顶秘银锻造的头盔形似舒展的右掌。

灵掌斥敌。若 5 尺范围内的生物对你进行近战攻击检定，作为一个反应，你可以召唤一个灵体掌，将该生物推离 10 尺。该生物需进行一次 DC15 的力量豁免检定。若失败，则其陷入倒地状态。若成功，该生物会保持站立状态。

此特性一旦使用，在下次长休或短休之前不能再次使用。

Spectral Repulsion.name: 灵掌斥敌
Spectral Repulsion.description:
在攻击之前你被推开了，因此未能命中目标。

此能力适用于 Midi QoL 工作流，并应应用于攻击到“洞明掌盔”佩戴者。

Nux Hemera (Rare) v1.name: 昼夜双生戒（珍稀）v1
Nux Hemera (Rare) v1.description:
奇物，珍稀

“一串由银与金交织而成的戒指。在阳光的恩泽下，治愈的力量悄然涌现，而月光的怀抱中则藏着无尽的奥秘。”

这枚戒指将金银之美熔于一炉，上面錾刻着两位女神侧颜，其形状被设计为象征着太阳和月亮这两颗天体的形象。

此枚戒指有 3 发充能，戒指每日黎明时恢复全部已消耗充能。

作为一个动作消耗 1 发充能，将持戒手的掌心覆于生物体表，为其恢复[[/r 4d4]]点生命值。

日落后，疗效果将逆转为死灵侵蚀：对目标造成[[/r 4d4]]点暗蚀伤害，伤口会浮现银白色月牙形灼痕。

Nux Hemera (Uncommon) v1.name: 昼夜双生戒（非普通）v1
Nux Hemera (Uncommon) v1.description:
奇物，非普通

“一串由银与金交织而成的戒指。在阳光的恩泽下，治愈的力量悄然涌现，而月光的怀抱中则藏着无尽的奥秘。”

这枚戒指将金银之美熔于一炉，上面錾刻着两位女神侧颜，其形状被设计为象征着太阳和月亮这两颗天体的形象。

此枚戒指有 2 发充能，戒指每日黎明时恢复全部已消耗充能。

作为一个动作消耗 1 发充能，将持戒手的掌心覆于生物体表，为其恢复[[/r 2d4]]点生命值。

日落后，疗效果将逆转为死灵侵蚀：对目标造成[[/r 2d4]]点暗蚀伤害，伤口会浮现银白色月牙形灼痕。

Torch.name: 火把
Torch.description: 火把点燃后能够燃烧 1 小时，燃烧期间发出 20 尺半径的明亮光照和额外 20 尺的微光光照。当你执行攻击动作时，你可以将火把当作简易近战武器，并使用火把发动攻击。命中时，目标受到 1 点火焰伤害。

Mechanics.name: 机制
Mechanics.text:
1. 使用该物品需进行装备与同调。

  2. 在被玩家或NPC装备前，可修改此物品的名称。魔法物品已装备后不建议进行重命名操作。

  3. 在使用反应后，引发近战攻击的指示物的下一次攻击将自动失手。这是通过一个名为“灵掌斥敌”的主动效应来实现的。（仅限 Midi QoL）

  • 该物品具有两项行动：

    • 使用反应 — 在攻击前作为反应动作使用，将触发推离攻击目标的动画效果。

    • 豁免 — 在目标生物被推离 10 尺后生效。若目标生物未能通过豁免检定，则陷入倒地状态。

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: 难度调整
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
本次遭遇战的战斗难度可动态调整，其具体强度取决于以下因素：玩家角色等级、魔法物品储备、队伍规模、战场环境、敌人数量以及每个敌人的挑战等级。

本冒险模组默认针对 4 名 3-4 级的玩家角色设计，但亦可调整为其他等级。

最简易的难度调节方式是修改怪物的生命值、护甲值或伤害值。

ADVENTURE SUMMARY.name: 冒险概要
ADVENTURE SUMMARY.text:
圣所历史

很久以前，誓言骑士圣所曾是一处礼拜场所，也是骑士与战士们立下誓言的圣地。他们在此宣誓将生命奉献于正义、守护与服务。

当战争召唤他们离去时，骑士们用强大的防护结界封印了圣所，确保其安全直至归来。他们唤醒了先祖之魂代为守护，令这些永恒的护卫看顾神圣殿堂。

然而，战争中无一骑士生还。他们的组织湮灭，圣所也在岁月流逝中被世人遗忘。

近期发现

数代以来，圣所始终掩藏于荒芜废墟之下，未被外界触及。直到部分结构坍塌，一条通往下方密封地穴的通道显露，局面才被打破。

途经的旅人报告称听见远处传来低语，却无人敢踏入其中。

圣所重现的消息引起了"银辉守望者"组织的关注。该组织致力于阻止古老废弃的权能之地释放出超越其墙垣的威胁。

埃米尔·科维安爵士、佩特罗斯·瓦列斯库爵士与扈从格雷戈尔·马洛夫被派往调查这座新现世圣所的异动。作为银辉守望的成员，他们的职责是确保其中遗留之物被遏制或安息。

队伍使命

冒险者们必须从地穴寻路至圣所，并发现银辉守望的骑士们已然殒命——埃米尔·科维安爵士正被守护圣所的远古幽魂附身。

他们需抉择：通过劝说、对抗或驱魔手段解放被附身的骑士，并净化圣所。

SIR EMIL CORVIAN.name: 埃米尔·科维安爵士
SIR EMIL CORVIAN.text:
埃米尔·科维安爵士

护甲等级： 18（锁甲）

生命值： 33（6d8 + 6）

速度： 30尺

属性：

  • 力量： 16（+3）
  • 敏捷： 10（+0）
  • 体质： 13（+1）
  • 智力： 10（+0）
  • 感知： 12（+1）
  • 魅力： 16（+3）

挑战等级： 1（200 XP）

外观： 身着锁甲，佩带长剑与盾牌，披橙色斗篷。

背景： 埃米尔·科维安爵士是银辉守望的骑士，以恪守纪律和虔诚著称。虽受训为战士，仍渴望成为圣武士以济世护民。他力求证明自己配得上神圣使命，期盼终获神启。

动作

  1. 长剑。 近战武器攻击：命中 +5，触及 5 尺，单一目标。命中：8（1d8 + 3）挥砍伤害。

埃米尔·科维安爵士语录

职责与荣耀：

  1. "骑士所求非声名显赫，唯愿以身为盾，守护无辜者于灾厄之前。"

圣武士之道：

  1. "不必做最睿智之人，但求成为危难时最后一个倒下者。"
  2. "若诸神无意择我，我便以血汗铸就神眷之阶。"

箴言集：

  1. "思虑过甚反成桎梏，持守正道则万法自通。"
  2. "我虽不识万象玄机，然明辨是非足矣。"
  3. "察人危难无需聪颖，但凭赤诚足矣。"

ADVENTURE HOOKS.name: 冒险引子
ADVENTURE HOOKS.text:
1. 失踪的调查队

自埃米尔·科维安爵士、骑士佩特罗斯·瓦列斯库与扈从格雷戈尔·马洛夫被派往调查圣所以来，银辉守望者便与他们失去了联系。冒险队伍受命查明他们的下落。

2. 消逝的踪迹

当冒险者在城镇之间行进时，在葱郁密林边缘发现了一处刚刚熄灭的篝火。附近的泥土上有数串脚印，它们在小径汇集后，共同朝着一处几乎看不清的废墟延伸，那里的石质建筑有一半被缠绕的树根和蔓生的植物掩埋了。遗迹看似古老而久被遗忘，但近期活动的痕迹表明此处不久前还有人来过。

THE CRYPT.name: 地穴
THE CRYPT.text:
地穴

描述

通往被遗忘圣所的地下入口由石砌廊道与墓室构成，主体作为安葬之所。石头阶梯向下延伸至中央墓室，墙面排列着棺椁，部分置于小型壁龛中，此处曾是阵亡骑士或英灵的长眠之地。

GM 笔记：

  • 此处 GM 可向玩家分发 @UUID[Item.orrPrIEzwNfj80jy]{火把}。

向北是一条狭窄的走廊，通向另一个墓穴壁龛，而东边的通道则通往一个更大的房间，里面还有更多的石棺。这个房间的北面和南面都有门，南门两侧各有一尊雕像，可能是守护神龛的守护者。房间里摆放着石凳、瓮罐以及一些仪式用品的残余，暗示着过去曾在此为逝者举行过庄重的仪式。

近期活动痕迹

  • 地砖积累的灰尘中，三个靴印在任何光源下都清晰可见。通过 [[/check sur 15]] 检定可辨明靴印是由三位穿重靴者留下。

  • 通过 [[/check inv 12]] 或 [[/check prc 12]] 检定可发现近期燃烧过的火把。

  • 在密闭空间进行 [[/check prc 14]] 检定可察觉木头烧焦的气味。

遭遇与挑战

荣誉试炼

北门上方与石壁融为一体的黯淡铭文需细致观察方能察觉。石门本身是厚重的滑移式石板。

角色需通过 [[/check inv 14]] 或 [[/check prc 12]] 检定以发现铭文。

施展法术侦测魔法显示石门带有预言系的魔法灵光，表明这道石门需要以话语开启而非蛮力。

一旦铭文显现，问题如下：

"骑士面前跪倒降投恶徒，如何处置方为荣耀之道？"

解法：玩家需口头应答符合圣所"荣誉、正义、仁慈"信条之举（如接受投降、公正审判或给予救赎）。符合则门启。

失败： 若提议残暴、复仇或不义之举（如"斩杀"或"刑讯逼供"），或试图 [[/check ath 18]] 强行破门，六具骷髅复苏。

"墓室壁龛的符文骤然燃亮。近乎呢喃的吟诵弥漫于空气之中。长眠者苏醒，将惩处不配踏入圣所之徒。"

GM 笔记：

  • 施展法术敲击术无法开启此门

  • 施展法术解除魔法需进行一次DC 15的施法属性检定

  • 若通过试炼开门，石门将保持开启 10 分钟后闭合

奉献试炼

南门上方镌刻着：

"骑士身负急令途遇伤者，如何处置方为奉献之道？"

解法：玩家需作出彰显利他责任的回应。强调仁爱之心、恪尽职守或将他人福祉置于自身便利之上的回答将被接纳。

失败：若提议弃伤者于不顾、质疑其获助价值或以任务为由拒绝行善，圣所将否决该答案。任何将奉献视为条件交换或利己之举的回应皆被视作不配。

无论如何回答，石门都将开启，未通过试炼或试图 [[/check ath 18]] 强行破门者将被施加诅咒。此后 48 小时内，该角色在进行游说与察觉检定时具有劣势。若试图从圣所带走物品，会听见责备的低语，每件物品造成 [[/r 1d4 psychic]]伤害。

该诅咒可以施展法术解除诅咒进行解除，也可以通过行善举来解除，比如捐赠财富、救助有需要的人或者不求回报地帮助他人。

HALL OF OATHS.name: 誓约大厅
HALL OF OATHS.text:
誓言大厅

描述

当冒险者们踏入这个房间时，石门石门轰然闭合并被封堵无法打开。誓言大厅内一片漆黑，没有光源。如果冒险者们携带光源，他们就会发现这是一个巨大的房间，曾经是神殿最神圣的仪式中心。房间内部是一个巨大的穹顶，房间由浮雕石壁、高耸拱顶与入口侧石阶高台构成。

高台中央的阶梯顶端安放着石棺，暗示着这是某位重要人物的安息之所。台阶的左右两侧，呈列阵排布。

在大厅的南北壁龛内存放着更多的石棺，可能是属于该骑士团的高级成员。

在大厅的尽头，数尊定格于痛苦姿态的石像分立两侧。一个身着长袍、散发柔和金光的兜帽雕像的雕像矗立在基座上，一手呈受贡姿态，另一手持石板。

在雕像投下的光亮中，一名骑士的尸体一动不动地躺在地上。看起来似乎已经死了好几天了。

GM 笔记：

  • 这位骑士是佩特罗斯·瓦莱斯库。

一个身着锁甲的人形站在中央石棺旁。他橙色的披风从双肩垂下，目光呆滞，凝视着空无一物之处。

GM 笔记：

  • 这位是被伊里安·瓦尼斯幽魂附体的埃米尔·科维安爵士

在棺材的左侧，一位年轻骑士的尸体躺在石板地上。他身下的血迹已经干涸，看起来似乎已经死了好几天了。

GM Notes:

  • 此为扈从格雷戈尔·马洛夫遗体

接着，毫无征兆地，那身着橙色披风的人动了动。他的姿势微微一变。他举起剑，先是朝向玩家们，然后指向大厅尽头那座发光的雕像。当他开口时，声音沉重而庄重，却又不完全像是正常人的声音。

“你等是否纯洁虔诚到足以进入此地？步入光明，立下誓言。由守护者裁断。”他庄重地命令道。

“倘若贪婪驱使着你等，那么你等将步前人后尘。警谕已示，圣地不容卑劣之徒。"

潜在问答

“你是谁？”
“名字已逝，但职责犹存，至死不渝。圣所长存，我亦如此。”

“这里发生了什么？”
“命运试炼。他们被认定不配。”

“守护者是什么？”
“守护者是裁决。是永不违背的誓言。是神之命运的终考。”

“守护者为谁效力？”
“只为誓言。只为圣所。”

"如何通过试炼？"
“卑劣者索取，高尚者奉献。跪下，言说，接受审判。”

“如果我们拒绝呢？”
 "那么你等前路尽断，圣所自当索取应得之物。"

“为何这座圣所被封印了？”
“那些本应侍奉之人未曾归来，也无人能称得上是忠诚。”

"你正附身这位骑士？"
"这副身躯承载信仰，但疑虑犹存。用杂质锻造的利刃在最终的考验中会折断。"

遭遇与挑战

守护者的审判

若冒险者们检查辉光中的骑士尸体，可发现其手中紧握着一张@UUID[JournalEntry.2LKpe3IBQuLucT3l]{羊皮纸}。

靠近雕像将发现发光石板上@UUID[JournalEntry.79kGY1hMdloavnVU]{铭文}。这些文字是用一种古老但可辨认的字体雕刻而成的。

GM 应让每位玩家大声诵念石板上所写的@UUID[JournalEntry.79kGY1hMdloavnVU]{誓词}根据玩家的表现，GM 应给予所需的 [[/skill religion persuasion 15]] 检定以优势或劣势。如果玩家背诵誓言时充满信念且认真，他们就以优势进行投掷。如果玩家犹豫不决、怀疑或不真诚，他们就以劣势进行投掷。

  • 若全员成功：圣所将被净化，保护结界消失，伊里安·瓦尼斯的幽魂释放埃米尔爵士。

    "职责现已传承于你等。圣所已结净，我终得安息….."

  • 若全员失败：被附身的骑士和骷髅们会转而对玩家怀有敌意。

    "如前人般，警谕已示。接下来就与他们同归沉寂。"

  • 若未全员成功: 守护者的光芒将会增强，且整个房间内的光芒每成功一次就扩大 15 英尺。每失败一次，就会有两具骷髅从墓碑区域出现。被附身的骑士和骷髅们会对失败者产生敌意。

    "诚誓者可前行。余者...自当直面命运。"

GM 笔记：

  • 幽魂与骷髅优先攻击失败玩家，并会一直战斗到失败玩家死亡。若埃米尔·科维安爵士死亡，冒险者们还必须与伊里安·瓦尼斯骑士长的幽魂战斗，此种情况下，GM 应从角色选项卡中将@UUID[Actor.0GgcraJyCKFRr9cC]{幽魂骑士}拖放到地图上。

  • 如果玩家们没有继续背诵《守护者的审判》，而是与除两具尸体之外的任何物品进行互动，那么就视为所有玩家都未能通过《守护者的审判》，战斗将立即开始。

解救埃米尔爵士的方式

情境一：呼唤名讳

如果冒险者们记得伊里安·瓦尼斯的名字（@UUID[JournalEntry.loHH5VaRl3eAkkHl]{来自地穴中的名讳之墙}），他们可以大声念出来以引起幽魂的注意。冒险者们第一次这么做时，埃米尔爵士会犹豫一下，仿佛听到自己的真名让他内心起了反应，使他陷入某种挣扎中。

技能鉴检定:

进行一次 [[/skill religion persuasion 15]] 可迫使幽魂回应。

成功时：

  • 伊里安灵体动摇，注意力转向诵名者。

  • 他的声音在埃米尔爵士急促的呼吸声中回荡，仿佛游离于生者与死者之间。

  • 幽魂终于直接开口说道：

    "为何...呼唤我的名讳？"

  • 玩家可进行劝说/辩论/挑战其附身的正当性。

情境二：神圣驱魔

冒险者可尝试施展驱散亡灵，迫使幽魂减弱对埃米尔爵士的控制。

成功时：

  • 伊里安灵体现形并怒吼，此时他的声音此刻充满愤怒，在大厅里回荡：

    “你竟敢将我驱逐？你以为你的信仰能胜过我的职责？”

  • 埃米尔爵士倒下了，解除附身但陷入力竭状态。

附加后果：

若在审判前触发此事件，四具骷髅将从墓碑区复苏。

INTRODUCTION.name: 简介
INTRODUCTION.text:
p>誓言之殿是一本基于DND 5 版规则设计的一次性冒险模组，适配 3-4 级角色。该冒险预计在 3-4 小时内完成。

故事发生在一座被遗忘的神殿内。

GHOST KNIGHT.name: 幽魂骑士
GHOST KNIGHT.text:
骑士指挥官伊里安·瓦尼斯

护甲等级： 11（天生护甲）

生命值： 44（10d8）

速度： 飞行 40 尺

属性：

  • 力量： 7（-2）
  • 敏捷： 13（+1）
  • 体质： 10（+0）
  • 智力： 10（+0）
  • 感知： 12（+1）
  • 魅力： 17（+3）

感官： 黑暗视觉60尺

伤害免疫： 寒冷、暗蚀、毒素

抗性： 钝击、穿刺、挥砍

状态免疫： 魅惑、力竭、恐慌、擒抱、麻痹、石化、中毒、倒地、束缚

挑战等级： 4（1100 XP）

动作

  1. 枯萎触击。

    近战武器攻击:命中 +5，触及 5 尺 单一目标。命中：>17 (4d6 + 3) 暗蚀伤害。

  2. 附身。幽魂身边 5 尺内它可以看见的一名类人生物必须进行一次DC 13 的魅力豁免，豁免失败则被幽魂附身。附身完成后幽魂消失，目标陷入失能且身体失去控制。该幽魂接管目标身体的控制权，但不剥夺目标的意识。

    该幽魂此时只能被驱散不死生物类效应指定为目标，其他任何攻击、法术或别的效应都无法将其指定为目标。此时的幽魂保留自己的阵营以及智力、感知、魅力属性，并且免疫魅惑和恐慌，其他资料则与被附身生物相同，但不能获得该目标的知识、职业特性和熟练项。

    该身体的生命值降至 0 时，幽魂受驱散或被如驱逐善恶 dispel evil and good 的法术效应迫出来时，附身终止。幽魂自身也可以主动以一个附赠动作终止附身。附身终止时，幽魂重新出现在该身体周边 5 尺内一处未被占据的空间位置。目标在豁免成功或附身终止后的 24 小时里对该幽魂的附身免疫。

特性

  1. 恐惧面容。幽魂周边 60 尺内能看见它的非不死生物必须分别进行一次DC 13 的感知豁免，豁免失败者将陷入 1 分钟的恐慌状态。若豁免失败且差值为 5 或更低，则目标还将衰老 1d4×10 年。

    该受恐慌目标可以在每个其自身回合结束时重复进行一次该豁免，豁免成功则终止自身的恐慌状态，而该目标也将在未来 24 小时内免疫该幽魂的恐惧面容。该衰老效应产生后的 24 小时内，可用高等复原术抵消。

  2. 虚体移动。 幽魂骑士可以如同穿过困难地形一样穿过其他生物和物件。

    如果它在自己的回合结束时仍处在物件内部则受到5（1d10）点力场伤害。

    幽魂骑士可以如同穿过困难地形一样穿过其他生物和物件。

  3. 以太视界。幽魂骑士在物质位面时可以看见身边 60 尺 以太位面的景色，在以太位面时可以看见身边 60 尺内物质位面的景色。

  4. 以太化。 幽魂骑士可以在物质位面和以太位面之间转换。身处以太边境时，物质位面中也可以看到它，反之亦然。幽魂身处其中某一位面时，无法影响另一位面之物或被另一位面之物影响。

POST-ENCOUNTER.name: 遭遇战后
POST-ENCOUNTER.text:
若圣所完成净化（通过守护者审判或使用performing the one-hour ritual from the @UUID[JournalEntry.jJ4dnug3cyDs0pRj]{骑士祷文书}进行一小时仪式），誓约大厅尽头的雕像手掌将显现战锤。此外，地穴中的所有门都会解锁。

GM 笔记：

  • 如果使用提供的宏（@UUID[Macro.Z9bJ2ypuOChgtFT6]）来更新光的发散半径，当光的范围达到 75 或更大时，战锤会自动出现。

如果净化未完成，战锤不会出现。不过，冒险者们可以搜查大厅内的棺材，找回曾与阵亡骑士一同埋葬的物品。门仍然紧闭，冒险者们必须通过一次 [[/check ath 18]] 检定来强行打开它们。

如果埃米尔爵士幸存下来，他可能会因自己不够强大而无法抵抗而感到内疚。根据情况，他可能会说以下这些话：

"我...我无法阻止他。他利用我，迫我亲手背弃誓言。"

"你完成了我无法完成的使命，践行了我未尽之责。我欠你一份人情。"

“在此立下的誓言本就不是要永远遵守的。你让他们解脱了。”

“我迷失了多久？我……伤及了多少无辜？”

佩特罗斯...格雷戈尔...我本该护你们周全。"

"他们随我至此，而我却把他们引向了死亡。"

结果与后续

  • 银辉守望者可能给予队伍嘉奖。
  • 圣所遗迹可能吸引学者/祭司前来考据。

Handout: Parchment found on the Fallen K.name: 展示材料：倒下的骑士身上发现的羊皮纸

DESCRIPTION.name: 描述
DESCRIPTION.text:
圣所结界永固，我等出征之日即其至洁隐晦之时。归来之勇士们：唯最虔信者诵念守护者石板全文，方可破障复誓。光明涤暗，圣所乃得重归纯粹。

誓言骑士团元老会，圣所最后的守护者

DESCRIPTION.name: 描述
DESCRIPTION.text:
几尊古老的陶瓮，蜡封完好且铭刻骑士团纹章。部分已破损的陶瓮内容物散失，少数仍保存完整。

开启陶瓮可见其内盛满骨灰。

Handout: Keeper Tablet Inscription.name: 展示材料：守护者石碑铭文

DESCRIPTION.name: 描述
DESCRIPTION.text:
踏上此途，便是立誓。
只取不与，便是背叛。
言而无信，便是亵渎。
唯屈膝虔信者得于荣光中屹立。

愿守护者衡量我心。
愿我言语为人所知。
若我堪任，前路当启，
若我有亏，名讳尽湮。

DESCRIPTION.name: 描述
DESCRIPTION.text:
此瓮中有六支火把。

@UUID[Item.orrPrIEzwNfj80jy]{火把}

DESCRIPTION.name: 描述
DESCRIPTION.text:
房间中央的棺椁内安放着骑士遗骸，内有一副锈蚀铠甲及一枚戒指

@UUID[Item.WYE3zmLR2z26dxt6]{昼夜双生戒}

@Embed[Item.WYE3zmLR2z26dxt6 caption=false cite=false]

DESCRIPTION.name: 描述
DESCRIPTION.text:
我们曾是这片圣地最后的守护者，受荣誉与誓言的约束，立誓于这些石块之上。我们的使命清晰明确：保护弱者，审判不配之人，保持警惕，守护这片圣地。

但职责并非总在石砌殿堂之内等待。战火降临这片土地，骑士团被召唤出这道围墙。我们无法拒绝这一召唤。

于是，我们封上了大门。我们设下了结界。我们举行了最后的仪式，将必须隐藏的东西封印起来。

我们只留下寂静与石块，相信无人会打扰这片圣地。

尽管我们已走出这道围墙，誓言却并未终结。倘若我们未能归来，知晓这一点。我们的先辈会代我们而立。他们的守望永恒，他们的审判坚定不移。

若你心地纯洁，所为正义，那就向前，接受审判。但若贪婪指引你的道路，若你的灵魂背离了美德，那就回头吧。这里对你而言只有长久坚守誓言的回响。

凭我们的职责与誓言，誓言骑士团，圣地最后的守护者。

Handout: North Coffin Content (Optional).name: 展示材料：北棺内容（可选）

DESCRIPTION.name: 描述
DESCRIPTION.text:
房间北面的棺椁内有一顶形状像张开的手掌的奇怪头盔。

@UUID[Item.HBgr238AjrhXMaPR]{洞明掌盔}

@Embed[Item.HBgr238AjrhXMaPR caption=false cite=false]

DESCRIPTION.name: 描述
DESCRIPTION.text:
一本曾由圣所入门者诵读的充满誓言和净化仪式的书。

在誓约大厅遭遇战结束后，圣武士或牧师可以从这本册子中选择仪式，施行一小时仪式以净化圣所。

仪式不得被任何人打断或干扰，若骑士长伊里安·瓦尼斯的幽魂仍在场，其会积极阻止玩家进行仪式。

仪式完成后，每个玩家周围的辉光光环会向外扩展 15 尺，这表明圣所已被净化。

DESCRIPTION.name: 描述
DESCRIPTION.text:
墙的砖石上刻着一连串的名字，记录着曾在神殿内宣誓效忠的阵亡勇士。许多铭文已模糊不清，难以辨认，但仍有几处依稀可辨。其中有一个名字格外醒目，想必是一位首领：伊里安·瓦恩斯骑士长。

GM 笔记：: 伊里安·瓦尼斯正是附身埃米尔爵士的幽魂本名，现身于誓约大厅。若玩家记诵其名讳，可尝试劝服幽魂释放被附身骑士。

DESCRIPTION.name: 描述
DESCRIPTION.text:
一个木箱用铁条加固，岁月已消磨了它不少光泽。锁早已锈坏，轻易就能打开。

Content of the Chest

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.gbJDLHTTjhwGOrrK]{展示材料：羊皮纸}详述了圣所最后的日子。

  • 银质徽章（对学者或骑士组织价值 50 GP）

DESCRIPTION.name: 描述
DESCRIPTION.text:
这个结实的箱子用银色镶嵌物加固，上面刻着骑士团风格的铭文，用的是已失传的方言。锁依然完好无损。

技能检定

  • [[/tool thief 15]] 检定开锁，或 [[/tool str 16]] 检定破拆。

箱内物品

  • 125 SP

  • 密封的暗红色药水瓶（强效治疗药水）

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.jJ4dnug3cyDs0pRj]{展示材料：骑士祷文书}

The Soulbound Knight.name: 魂缚骑士
The Soulbound Knight.description:
该遭遇发生在一座被遗忘的墓穴中——这是个不洁之地，石桥横跨着翻涌迷失灵魂的漩涡。空气中回荡着低语，夹杂着被困者和受诅者的呢喃。魂缚骑士，一位受永恒奴役诅咒的亡灵战士，挥舞着名为"收割者"的长柄刀。他操纵以太能量并驱使受折磨的灵魂守护墓穴及其黑暗秘密。石桥后方耸立着宏伟的陵墓，厚重的石门守卫着不尽秘密。

作为奖励，玩家可获得"收割者"——这把由魂缚骑士使用、灌注以太能量的强力武器。

模组包含日志条目，其中记录了遭遇的所有细节、背景故事与战术信息。
The Soulbound Knight.caption: 魂缚骑士遭遇

Soul Servant CR1/4.name: 魂仆 CR1/4
Soul Servant CR1/4.description: 魂仆是受折磨灵魂的残留，被束缚以侍奉更强大的亡灵主人。它们呈现为小型鬼魅光芒，在空中无声飘荡。其接触可释放强力的电击与暗蚀冲击。

Ethereal Sight.name: 以太视界
Ethereal Sight.description: 魂仆在物质位面时可以看见身边 60 尺 以太位面的景色，在以太位面时可以看见身边 60 尺内物质位面的景色。

Ethereal Invisibility.name: 以太隐形
Ethereal Invisibility.description: 以太隐形。魂仆处于隐形状态直至其发动一次攻击。

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description:
魂仆可以如同穿过困难地形一样穿过其他生物和物件。

如果它在自己的回合结束时仍处在物件内部则受到 [[/roll 1d10]]点力场伤害。

魂仆可以如同穿过困难地形一样穿过其他生物和物件。

Necrotic Shock.name: 暗蚀冲击
Necrotic Shock.description: Necrotic Shock. 近战法术攻击：命中 +4，触及 5 尺，单一目标。命中： [[/roll 1d4]] 点闪电伤害和 [[/roll 1d4]] 点暗蚀伤害。若目标穿戴金属护甲，则其下一次攻击检定或属性检定具有劣势，直至目标下一回合结束。

Soul Rejuvenation.name: 灵魂复生
Soul Rejuvenation.description: 灵魂复生。当魂仆的生命值降为 0 时，魂缚骑士恢复 [[/r 5d8 + 20]] 点生命值。

Soulbound Knight CR4.name: 魂缚骑士 CR4
Soulbound Knight CR4.description:
魂缚骑士语录

战前：

  1. “你闯入了圣地。无人能全身而退。”
  2. “我的灵魂被这悲惨之地束缚。你将与我一同陷入永恒的痛苦。”
  3. “巫妖的意志命令我，我必须服从。准备迎接毁灭吧。”

战斗中：

  1. “你们的命运已定，就像我的一样。”
  2. “你无法逃脱亡者的掌控！”
  3. “见证收割者的力量！”
  4. “这里绝无庇护。”
  5. “停下徒劳的挣扎吧；我的仆从们渴望你的灵魂。”

使用虚幻打击时：

  1. “看啊，生与死之间的领域！”
  2. “感受以太的触碰！”
  3. “你会体验到夹缝中的绝望。”

使用灵魂复生治疗时：

  1. “你的挣扎徒劳无功；我已然重新强大！”
  2. “你越是挣扎，我就越强大！”
  3. “他们的牺牲让我更加强大！”

使用灵魂召唤时：

  1. “当心被遗忘的怨灵！”
  2. “他们的折磨将是你的终结！”
  3. “面对被遗忘灵魂的愤怒！”
  • “被遗忘者的灵魂将是你的最终宿命。”
  • “拥抱前人的绝望吧。”

    • 重伤时：

    1. “黑暗……正收紧它的魔爪。”
    2. “我的末日将至，但你的也不远了！”

    战败时：

    1. “终于……从这折磨中解脱了……”
    2. “诅咒……终于……解除了……”
    3. “在死亡中……我找到了安宁……”

Plate Armor.name: 板甲
Plate Armor.description: 板甲由覆盖全身，且相互连接的模铸金属板组成。一套板甲包括护手、重皮靴、一顶附面甲的头盔以及在护甲底层的厚重的布甲。其锁扣和皮带结构可以将护甲重量分配到身体各处。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: 魂缚骑士使用其长柄刀”收割者“发动两次近战攻击。

Ethereal Sight.name: 以太视界
Ethereal Sight.description: 魂缚骑士在物质位面时可以看见身边 60 尺 以太位面的景色，在以太位面时可以看见身边 60 尺内物质位面的景色。

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: 魂缚骑士对抗法术和其他魔法效应时进行的豁免检定具有优势。

Soulbound Fortitude.name: 魂缚坚韧
Soulbound Fortitude.description:
当魂缚骑士因非光耀非重击伤害生命值降低至 0 时，其进行一次体质体质豁免（DC为 5 + 所受伤害）。豁免成功则改为将生命值降至 1。

当魂缚骑士因伤害生命值降低至 0 时，其进行一次体质体质豁免。

Soul Sacrifice.name: 灵魂献祭

Spirit Call.name: 唤魂

收割者是一柄长柄刀，其柄顶镶嵌骷髅头，刀刃自颅骨中延伸而出。

LORE.name: 逸闻
LORE.text: 曾经身为英勇圣武士的魂缚者，在一场与邪恶巫妖的激烈战斗中遭遇了悲惨的结局。他被巫妖的黑暗魔法所控制，其堕落的灵魂被囚禁在一套威严的板甲之中，被迫永远守护着巫妖法杖藏匿的那座被遗忘的陵墓。他的武器——一根顶端立着骷髅的长柄刀，刀刃从骷髅中伸出——曾是他自己的头骨，如今却成了他永世奴役的悲剧象征。

BOSS.name: BOSS
BOSS.text:
魂缚骑士

护甲等级： 18（板甲）

生命值： 85（10d8 + 40）

速度： 30 尺

属性：

  • 力量： 18（+4）
  • 敏捷： 11（+0）
  • 体质： 18（+4）
  • 智力： 10（+0）
  • 感知： 12（+1）
  • 魅力： 14（+2）

感官： 黑暗视觉 60 尺

语言： 生前掌握的语言

伤害免疫： 毒素

伤害抗性： 暗蚀，非魔法攻击的钝击、穿刺和挥砍

伤害易伤： 光耀

状态免疫： 魅惑、力竭、恐慌、中毒

挑战等级： 4（1100 XP）

外观： 魂缚骑士是可怖的亡灵战士，生前曾是堕落圣武士。它表现为一套由幽魂能量驱动的威严板甲，旋绕的灵体透过面甲缝隙与关节处隐约可见。

动作

  1. 多重攻击。 魂缚骑士用长柄刀"收割者"发动两次近战攻击。

  2. 武器（长柄刀）收割者能力：

    • 黑暗收割。 收割者攻击命中生物时，额外造成[[/roll 1d4]]点暗蚀伤害。若该生物死亡，你的下一次攻击具有优势。

    • 虚幻打击。 以一个动作，你可以发动一次虚幻打击。以此能力攻击命中一名生物时，目标必须进行一次DC 15 的魅力豁免。豁免失败，目标将陷入以太状态，持续[[/roll 1d4]]轮，存在于物质位面与以太位面边缘的重叠空间，与两界的互动都极为有限。目标可以观察原位面，但是所有事物都以灰度显示，而目标也看不到 60 尺外的东西。目标攻击检定具有劣势，无法穿越实体墙壁，且受到来自两个位面攻击的伤害。持续时间结束后，目标在物质位面重现。一旦使用，该能力在下一次长休前将无法使用。

    • 灵魂收割。以一个动作，你可以旋转收割者释放暗蚀能量爆发，以自身为源点，10 尺范围内的所有生物需进行一次DC 15 的敏捷豁免。豁免失败者承受[[/roll 1d10]]点挥砍伤害外加[[/roll 1d8]]点暗蚀伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。一旦使用，该能力在下一次长休前将无法使用。

  3. 唤魂。以一个附赠动作，魂缚骑士可以从迷失灵魂的漩涡中召唤出两名灵魂侍从攻击他的敌人们。

  4. 灵魂献祭。 以一个附赠动作，魂缚骑士可以摧毁其一名魂仆激活灵魂复生。

特质

  1. 强化虚幻打击。若没有目标受到以太状态影响，魂缚骑士可以再次使用虚幻打击。

  2. 强化灵魂收割。此能力在 d6 掷骰中，骰值为 5-6 时恢复充能。

  3. 虚幻召回。以一个附赠动作将收割者从任意位置传送至手中。

  4. 魔法抗性。魂缚骑士对抗法术和其他魔法效应时进行的豁免检定具有优势。

  5. 以太视界。魂缚骑士在物质位面时可以看见身边 60 尺以太位面的景色，在以太位面时可以看见身边 60 尺内物质位面的景色。

  6. 魂缚坚韧。当魂缚骑士因非光耀非重击伤害生命值降低至 0 时，其进行一次体质体质豁免（DC为 5 + 所受伤害）。豁免成功则改为将生命值降至 1。

魂缚骑士语录

战前：

  1. “你闯入了圣地。无人能全身而退。”
  2. “我的灵魂被这悲惨之地束缚。你将与我一同陷入永恒的痛苦。”
  3. “巫妖的意志命令我，我必须服从。准备迎接毁灭吧。”

战斗中：

  1. “你们的命运已定，就像我的一样。”
  2. “你无法逃脱亡者的掌控！”
  3. “见证收割者的力量！”
  4. “这里绝无庇护。”
  5. “停下徒劳的挣扎吧；我的仆从们渴望你的灵魂。”

使用虚幻打击时：

  1. “看啊，生与死之间的领域！”
  2. “感受以太的触碰！”
  3. “你会体验到夹缝中的绝望。”

使用灵魂复生治疗时：

  1. “你的挣扎徒劳无功；我已然重新强大！”
  2. “你越是挣扎，我就越强大！”
  3. “他们的牺牲让我更加强大！”

使用灵魂召唤时：

  1. “当心被遗忘的怨灵！”
  2. “他们的折磨将是你的终结！”
  3. “面对被遗忘灵魂的愤怒！”
  1. “被遗忘者的灵魂将是你的最终宿命。”
  2. “拥抱前人的绝望吧。”

重伤时：

  1. “黑暗……正收紧它的魔爪。”
  2. “我的末日将至，但你的也不远了！”

战败时：

  1. “终于……从这折磨中解脱了……”
  2. “诅咒……终于……解除了……”
  3. “在死亡中……我找到了安宁……”

LOCATION.name: 地点
LOCATION.text: 该遭遇发生在一座被遗忘墓穴的广阔厅堂中。其中心处，一座石桥横跨翻涌着迷失灵魂的漩涡，受困者与受诅者的低语声在漩涡中回荡。石桥尽头赫然矗立着一座宏伟陵墓，其巨大的石门在墓室的昏暗中显得格外阴森。

ADVENTURE HOOK.name: 冒险引子
ADVENTURE HOOK.text:
意外发现。冒险者门误入了被遗忘的墓穴，浑然不知此处封存着邪恶巫妖的命匣。受困其中时，他们必须穿越重重险境以求生路，同时揭开黑暗秘密。

救赎之序。 圣武士组织欲解救墓穴中受诅咒奴役的堕落圣武士，雇佣冒险者对抗亡灵守卫、直面骑士本尊，并寻找让其安息的方法。

巫妖遗产。冒险者们在一座古老的图书馆中发现的一张地图指向了一座被遗忘的的古代墓穴，据说里面安息着一位邪恶的巫妖。冒险者们试图找到这座古墓，并获取据说藏于其中的黑暗神器和禁忌知识。

幽魂守卫。村民门传言有一处受诅的墓穴中游荡着不安的灵魂。冒险者受雇调查并安息这些亡魂，却不知背后隐藏着一位亡灵法师的秘密计划。

往昔回响。冒险者门偶然获得一本神秘日志，记录着一段另一伙冒险者的英勇旅程，旨在消灭威胁王国的古老邪恶力量。这本日志暗示着在一片荒原深处藏着一个被遗忘的墓穴。

MECHANICS.name: 机制
MECHANICS.text:
1. 本遭遇中魂仆默认隐形。受虚幻打击陷入以太状态影响的角色将能看见魂仆仆。实现方式：指示物配置→视觉选项卡→感知模式→添加 60 尺范围的识破隐形效应。切记效应结束后删除该感知模式！
    或使用预设宏：为选定指示物添加/移除识破隐形

  2. 可将光照的暗度级别调至 ≥ 0.6 以增强画面压迫感

魂缚骑士

  1. 魂缚坚韧：GM需手动计算豁免DC（公式：5 + 所受伤害值），掷骰判定骑士死亡或保留1点生命值

  2. 灵魂献祭：先选定魂仆指示物→使用能力→该能力造成 6 点伤害（自动消灭魂仆）

魂仆

  1. 暗蚀冲击：对金属护甲目标不自动赋予劣势——需GM手动应用此效果

  2. 灵魂复生：先选定魂缚骑士指示物→使用能力→为目标恢复 5d8 + 20 点生命值

预设宏

@UUID[Macro.fStiChzWvan1bsUs]{为选定指示物添加/移除'识破隐形'效应}

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: 难度调整
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
本次遭遇战的战斗难度可动态调整，其具体强度取决于以下因素：玩家角色等级、魔法物品储备、队伍规模、战场环境、敌人数量以及每个敌人的挑战等级。

CR4 BOSS的难度示例评估：

  • 对于 4 名等级为 2 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为致命。
  • 对于 4 名等级为 3 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为致命。
  • 对于 4 名等级为 4 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为高。
  • 对于 4 名等级为 5 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为中等。

最简易的难度调节方式是修改怪物的生命值、护甲值或伤害值。

MINIONS.name: 奴仆
MINIONS.text:
魂仆是受折磨灵魂的残留，被束缚以侍奉更强大的亡灵主人。它们呈现为小型鬼魅光芒，在空中无声飘荡。其接触可释放强力的电击与暗蚀冲击。

魂仆

护甲等级： 12（天生护甲）

生命值： 6（2d6）

速度： 飞行 30 尺

属性：

  • 力量： 6（-2）
  • 敏捷： 14（+2）
  • 体质： 10（+0）
  • 智力： 5（-3）
  • 感知： 10（+0）
  • 魅力： 8（-1）

感官： 黑暗视觉 60 尺

语言： 通晓生前所知语言但无法言语

伤害免疫： 暗蚀，毒素

伤害抗性： 强酸，冷冻，闪电，雷鸣，非魔法攻击的钝击、穿刺和挥砍

状态免疫： 魅惑，擒抱，力竭，麻痹，中毒，倒地，石化，束缚

挑战等级： 1/4（50 XP）

动作

  1. 暗蚀冲击。 近战法术攻击： 命中 +4，触及 5 尺，单一目标。命中： [[/roll 1d4]]闪电伤害加[[/roll 1d4]]暗蚀伤害。

特质

  1. 灵魂复生。当魂仆的生命值降为 0 时，魂缚骑士恢复 [[/r 5d8 + 20]] 点生命值。

  2. 以太视界。 魂仆在物质位面时可以看见身边 60 尺 以太位面的景色，在以太位面时可以看见身边 60 尺内物质位面的景色。

  3. 虚体移动。 魂仆可以如同穿过困难地形一样穿过其他生物和物件。

    如果它在自己的回合结束时仍处在物件内部则受到 [[/roll 1d10]]点力场伤害

  4. 以太隐形。魂仆处于隐形状态直至其发动一次攻击。

TACTICS.name: 战术
TACTICS.text:
• 当冒险者们抵达陵墓阶梯时，石门开启，魂缚骑士现身与冒险者们对峙。

  • 魂缚骑士优先反复发动虚幻打击，直至成功使玩家陷入以太状态。

  • 每回合使用唤魂驱使灵魂漩涡中的两个灵魂攻击敌人（加入两名魂仆参战）。

  • 若其生命值偏低，可通过灵魂献祭摧毁魂仆恢复生命。

  • 魂缚骑士将伺机发动灵魂收割，同时攻击两名及以上玩家。

Mechanics.name: 机制
Mechanics.text:
1. 使用该物品需进行装备与同调。

  2. 在被玩家或NPC装备前，可修改此物品的名称。魔法物品已装备后不建议进行重命名操作。

    虚幻打击与灵魂收割能力名称必须永久保留原始命名。

  3. 虚幻打击操作流程：
    - 目标豁免失败时，将应用名为"Phantom Strike"的主动效应(Active Effect/AE)
    - GM需掷骰[[/roll 1d4]]并手动跟踪效应轮数
    - 效果移除时视觉特效自动终止
    视效补充操作：
    指示物配置→视觉选项卡→感知模式→添加 60 尺识破隐形→效应结束后务必删除！
    或使用宏指令：@UUID[Macro.fStiChzWvan1bsUs]{为选定指示物添加/移除'识破隐形'效果}

The Giant Abomination.name: 巨人憎恶
The Giant Abomination.description:
在一片被异常严寒所困扰的冰冷荒野深处，冒险者们遭遇了一位惊慌失措的村民，他刚刚从一名恐怖生物的袭击中死里逃生。巨人憎恶——一个曾经骄傲的巨人，因可怕的诅咒而扭曲——如今在一带内游荡，痴迷地想要保护藏在它巢穴里的神秘白龙蛋。冒险队伍的旅程将把他们带到河岸边一艘破碎的船骸处，那是他们首次遭遇这一怪物的地点。若怪物逃脱，冒险者们必须追踪它进入其黑暗冰冷的洞穴，在那里他们将与其展开一场背水一战的最终对决。

冒险者们必须揭开造就这怪物的诅咒背后的真相，并在冰封荒野将他们吞噬之前决定这枚龙蛋的命运。
The Giant Abomination.caption: 巨人憎恶遭遇

Giant Abomination CR4.name: 巨人憎恶 CR4
Giant Abomination CR4.description:
巨人憎恶语录

  1. “寒冷无尽... 如同我的折磨一般无尽。”
  2. “那寒冷...它在呼唤我...我必须找到它。”
  3. “你们不明白...我曾无比强大...但现在我被禁锢了！”
  4. “听见了吗？那霜寒的呼唤...我必须回应。你们阻止不了。”
  5. “这从来不是我的命运...我曾是巨人，是守护者...如今，我什么都不是。”

Icewalker.name: 冰上行走
Icewalker.description: 冰上行走。巨人憎恶可以在冰面上穿行和攀爬而无需进行属性检定。此外，其穿过由冰或雪组成的困难地形时也不需要花费额外的移动力。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: 多重攻击。 巨人憎恶发动两次近战攻击。

Frost Explosion.name: 霜冻爆破
Frost Explosion.description: 霜冻光环。巨人憎恶回合开始时，位于源自巨人憎恶的 5 尺光环内的所有生物受到 3（1d6）寒冷伤害。

Frost Trail.name: 寒霜小径
Frost Trail.description: 寒霜小径（充能 4-6）。巨人憎恶体引导其冰寒之力，冻结源自其自身、长 30 尺、宽 5 尺的线状区域的地表。该寒霜持续存在 1 分钟，并视为困难地形。当寒霜出现时，位于该区域内的所有生物必须成功通过一次DC 12 的敏捷豁免，否则陷入倒地状态。

Frost Missile.name: 霜冻飞弹
Frost Missile.description:
霜冻飞弹（充能 5-6）。巨人憎恶体张开嘴，向 30 尺内其可见的一点发射一枚霜冻飞弹。飞弹在该点为源点的 15 尺半径的范围内爆发出一股寒流。

范围内的所有生物必须进行一次DC 12 的敏捷豁免检定，豁免失败将受到 14（4d6）点寒冷伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。该区域会被一层湿滑的冰霜覆盖，持续 1 分钟，并变为困难地形。

Shiverstrike.name: 寒颤打击
Shiverstrike.description: 寒颤打击。 近战武器攻击： 命中 +7，触及 10 尺，单一目标。命中： 7（1d6 + 4）点挥砍伤害外加 3（1d6）点寒冷伤害。

Frost Trail.name: 寒霜小径
Frost Trail.description: 寒霜小径（充能 4-6）。巨人憎恶体引导其冰寒之力，冻结源自其自身、长 30 尺、宽 10 尺的线状区域的地表。该寒霜持续存在 1 分钟，并视为困难地形。当寒霜出现时，位于该区域内的所有生物必须成功通过一次DC 14 的敏捷豁免，否则陷入倒地状态。

Frozen Retaliation.name: 霜冻报偿
Frozen Retaliation.description: 霜冻报偿。当一名位于巨人憎恶 10 尺内的生物以近战攻击命中它时，憎恶体可以释放一股寒流。攻击者必须成功通过一次DC 14 的体质豁免检定，否则将受到 9（2d8）点寒冷伤害，且其速度减少 10 尺，直至其下一回合结束。

Frozen Retaliation.name: 霜冻报偿
Frozen Retaliation.description: 你的速度降至 0，直至你的下一回合结束。

Frost Missile.name: 霜冻飞弹
Frost Missile.description:
霜冻飞弹（充能 5-6）。巨人憎恶体张开嘴，向 60 尺内其可见的一点发射一枚霜冻飞弹。飞弹在该点为源点的 15 尺半径的范围内爆发出一股寒流。

范围内的所有生物必须进行一次DC 14 的敏捷豁免检定，豁免失败将受到 21（6d6）点寒冷伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。该区域会被一层湿滑的冰霜覆盖，持续 1 分钟，并变为困难地形。

Head of Frost v2.name: 寒霜之首 v2
Head of Frost v2.description:
奇物，珍稀（需同调）

无处可逃... 寒霜无处可逃... 我也无处可逃！

这是一个巨人憎恶巨大而怪诞的沉重战利品。

霜冻飞弹。 以一个动作，你可以从其口中向 30 尺内你可见的一点发射一枚霜冻飞弹。飞弹在该点为源点的 15 尺半径的范围内爆发出一股寒流，对范围内所有生物造成 6d6 寒冷伤害。所有生物必须进行一次DC 14 敏捷豁免，豁免成功则仅受半伤。一旦使用，该能力在下一次短休前将无法使用。

诅咒。 使用此能力后，随着冰霜在你体表凝结，你的速度降低 5 尺，持续 1 小时。

Reduced Movement.description: 随着冰霜在你体表凝结，你的速度降低 5 尺，持续 1 小时。

ADVENTURE HOOKS.name: 冒险引子
ADVENTURE HOOKS.text:
冒险者们跋涉在冰天雪地中，耳边传来沉重的脚步声与粗重的喘息声。一个男人跌跌撞撞闯入视野，双手紧握着一根破损的船桨，浑身湿透，身体因为寒冷而不住地颤抖。

“救命！它……它毁了我的船！一个怪物，它在找什么东西！求求你们，阻止它！”

这个男人是一名商人，在冰河上行船时遭到了怪物的袭击。当巨人憎恶摧毁他的船只时，他侥幸逃脱；那怪物一边破坏，一边念念有词地说着什么“圣物”和“被寒霜偷走的记忆”。

MAPS.name: 地图
MAPS.text:
冰雪河

当冒险者门接近船只残骸时，可见那怪物庞大畸形的身躯正以惊人速度翻找碎片，并未立即察觉他们。通过一次DC 14 的隐匿检定可以观察到怪物疯狂搜寻的姿态——它似乎在寻找贵重物品，那些它认为配得上龙蛋的珍宝，似乎试图取悦龙蛋或其中的存在。

若队伍未能隐匿行踪，巨人憎恶将立刻转身面对冒险者们：

“这...这是什么？更多的宝物...献给龙蛋！”

当生命值降至20 点或更低时，怪物将逃向洞穴。

战术与环境危害

冰河水视为困难地形。所有进入冰河的生物需通过一次DC 12 的力量豁免，否则将被水流冲向下游 10 尺。

巨人憎恶使用寒霜小径在河岸制造冰面，迫使敌人落水。

战斗开始将施放寒霜飞弹攻击扎堆的敌人。

憎恶巢穴

追踪巨人憎恶进入巢穴后，冒险者们发现自己置身于冰窟之中，刺骨寒意袭来，呼出的气息都凝成了白雾。洞穴深处散发的“冷光”在黑暗中透出微弱的光芒。“冷光”在冰壁上折射出幽灵般的阴影，微弱地照亮了前路。冒险者们踏入中央区域时，脚下积雪嘎吱作响。随着深入，光源逐渐清晰：一枚白色龙蛋置于一座壁龛中，正散发微光。

巨人憎恶佝偻在碎木与残骸堆前，扭曲身躯被龙蛋微光隐约照亮。怪物察觉到冒险者们的靠近时，动作骤然停滞，随后伴随着暴怒的低吼，怪物朝着冒险者们猛冲而来：

“你们是来偷宝物的！我要从尸体上扯下它！”

当巨人憎恶生命值将至一半时，它将退至蛋室发出绝望嘶吼：

“不！宝物绝不能落入你们手中！巨龙命令我守护它！”

战术与环境危害

回合开始时，巨人憎恶周围 10 尺内爆发霜冻爆破，对所有生物造成寒冷伤害。

使用寒颤打击发动两次近战攻击，优先锁定负重最重或携带魔法物品的生物，因为怪物认为这些东西很有价值。

对于没有寒冷相关适应能力的生物来说，巢穴内部的地面视为困难地形。

若有超过两名冒险者聚集，巨人憎恶将对他们施展霜冻飞弹。

若被夹击，巨人憎恶将制造30 尺寒霜小径阻碍冒险者们的行动，并退至龙蛋旁背水一战。

白色龙蛋散发 20 尺魔法霜冻灵光，范围内除巨人憎恶外所有生物的攻击检定具劣势。

BOSS.name: BOSS
BOSS.text:
巨人憎恶

护甲等级： 15（天生护甲）

生命值： 105（10d10 + 40）

速度： 30尺

属性：

  • 力量： 19（熟练 +7）
  • 敏捷： 10（+0）
  • 体质： 18（熟练 +7）
  • 智力： 6（-2）
  • 感知： 10（+0）
  • 魅力： 6（-2）

感官： 黑暗视觉 60 尺

语言： 通用语，巨人语

伤害免疫： 寒冷，钝击，穿刺，挥砍，力竭，恐慌

伤害易伤： 火焰

挑战等级： 7（2900 XP）

外观： 其身躯融合了人类的特征和怪异的比例。它的一只手巨且长，能够碾碎任何东西，而另一只手则又小又畸形。怪物的动作生硬、不自然且速度极快。

动作

  1. 冰上行走。巨人憎恶可以在冰面上穿行和攀爬而无需进行属性检定。此外，其穿过由冰或雪组成的困难地形时也不需要花费额外的移动力。

  2. 多重攻击。 巨人憎恶发动两次近战攻击。

  3. 霜冻爆破。巨人憎恶回合开始时，位于源自巨人憎恶的 5 尺光环内的所有生物受到 5（1d10）寒冷伤害。

  4. 寒颤打击。 近战武器攻击： 命中 +7，触及 10 尺，单一目标。命中： 14（2d8 + 4）点挥砍伤害外加 4（1d8）点寒冷伤害。

  5. 霜冻飞弹（充能 5-6）。巨人憎恶体张开嘴，向 60 尺内其可见的一点发射一枚霜冻飞弹。飞弹在该点为源点的 15 尺半径的范围内爆发出一股寒流。

    范围内的所有生物必须进行一次DC 14 的敏捷豁免检定，豁免失败将受到 21（6d6）点寒冷伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。该区域会被一层湿滑的冰霜覆盖，持续 1 分钟，并变为困难地形。

  6. 寒霜小径（充能 4-6）。巨人憎恶体引导其冰寒之力，冻结源自其自身、长 30 尺、宽 10 尺的线状区域的地表。该寒霜持续存在 1 分钟，并视为困难地形。当寒霜出现时，位于该区域内的所有生物必须成功通过一次DC 14 的敏捷豁免，否则陷入倒地状态。

  7. 霜冻报偿。当一名位于巨人憎恶 10 尺内的生物以近战攻击命中它时，憎恶体可以释放一股寒流。攻击者必须成功通过一次DC 14 的体质豁免检定，否则将受到 9（2d8）点寒冷伤害，且其速度减少 10 尺，直至其下一回合结束。

巨人憎恶语录

  1. “寒冷无尽... 如同我的折磨一般无尽。”
  2. “那寒冷...它在呼唤我...我必须找到它。”
  3. “你们不明白...我曾无比强大...但现在我被禁锢了！”
  4. “听见了吗？那霜寒的呼唤...我必须回应。你们阻止不了。”
  5. “这从来不是我的命运...我曾是巨人，是守护者...如今，我什么都不是。”

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: 难度调整
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
本次遭遇战的战斗难度可动态调整，其具体强度取决于以下因素：玩家角色等级、魔法物品储备、队伍规模、战场环境、敌人数量以及每个敌人的挑战等级。

本遭遇默认针对 4 名 7 级的玩家角色设计，但亦可调整为其他等级。

最简易的难度调节方式是修改怪物的生命值、护甲值或伤害值。

MECHANICS.name: 机制
MECHANICS.text:
巨人憎恶

  • 巨人憎恶能力（霜冻爆破、霜冻飞弹、寒霜小径、霜冻报偿、寒颤打击）可进行自定义（如修改能力名称、伤害值、DC、射程等）。

  • 霜冻爆破：GM须在巨人憎恶回合开始时主动触发此能力。

  • 霜冻报偿：GM根据情境自行决定是否发动。例如：当巨人憎恶遭受远程攻击时，此能力不应该被触发。

POST-ENCOUNTER.name: 遭遇战后
POST-ENCOUNTER.text:
一旦巨人憎恶被击败，冒险者有机会调查巢穴中的标记与龙蛋。可能出现以下发展：
龙蛋是一件强大的魔法物品。冒险者们可选择将其摧毁，或携带龙蛋离开。
洞穴壁刻表明，憎恶体原是一位被诅咒的巨人贵族，被迫守护龙蛋。这龙蛋可能与一个早已被遗忘的预言有关，或者与巨龙之间有着古老的契约。冒险者们也可能发现这怪物过去生活的日记，上面记载着它变形扭曲的过程、它疯狂的原因以及龙蛋的历史渊源。

Mechanics.name: 机制
Mechanics.text:
1. 使用该物品需进行装备与同调。

  2. 在被玩家或NPC装备前，可修改此物品的名称。魔法物品已装备后不建议进行重命名操作。

  3. 该物品的伤害值、射程及敏捷豁免检定可进行自定义调整。

The Hunger Beneath.name: The Hunger Beneath
The Hunger Beneath.description:
The Hunger Beneath is a one-shot adventure for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition, designed for characters of levels 6–7. It is intended to be completed in 4 to 5 hours. While the story is set in Underdark, it can easily be adapted to any subterranean environment, such as caverns, ruins, or dungeon complexes.

Long ago, a drow noble, once the consort of a drow priestess, embraced vampirism in an attempt to seize greater power. When he tried to raise an undead army and challenge the authority of his own people, he was defeated and imprisoned by the priestess within a crypt, sealed using arcane glyphs and blood rituals.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

materials.value: A bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

Darkness.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

Bloodseeker's Vengeance v1.name: Bloodseeker's Vengeance v1
Bloodseeker's Vengeance v1.description:
Weapon (shortbow), very rare (requires attunement)

"Just as my blood is the essence of life, my bow is the essence of death, wielding arrows that know no mercy."

Bloodseeker's Vengeance is a sinister-looking shortbow with carvings of veins and arteries along its limbs.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Bloodforged Arrows. When you draw the string of Bloodseeker's Vengeance, you sacrifice 2 hit points to create a blood arrow. This arrow, when fired, deals 1d6 piercing damage and 1d6 necrotic damage on a successful hit. You can choose to sacrifice additional hit points, up to a maximum of 8, to enhance the power of the blood arrow. For every 2 hit points sacrificed, the arrow's necrotic damage increases by 1d6, up to a maximum of 4d6 for 8 hit points sacrificed.

If creating a Bloodforged Arrow causes your hit points to drop to 0 you fall unconscious and the arrow fails to hit its target.

After hitting a creature with a blood arrow, you regain 1d6 hit points.

When the blood arrow strikes, a pool of blood forms at the creature's feet. This pool creates difficult terrain in a 5ft radius around that creature until the start of your next turn.

Curse of Macabre Attraction. The magic of the bow draws you closer to death's realm. You have vulnerability to necrotic damage and undead creatures are unnaturally drawn to you, often seeking you out in combat.

Curse of the Blood Reaper. The bow's insatiable appetite for blood becomes consuming. Whenever you roll a natural 20 with a blood arrow, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you shoot another Bloodforged Arrow at its maximum power sacrificing 8 hit points. If you have no enemy creature in range, you choose the nearest friendly creature as your target. This arrow does not grant any healing property. If creating this arrow causes your hit points to drop to 0, you fall unconscious.

MECHANICS.name: MECHANICS
MECHANICS.text:
How To Enable Map Notes

Animations (Optional)

To enable animations for abilities, spells and magic items, install the BLFX Assets & Animation Editor Premium module.

Rot Vampire

  • Regeneration should be triggered by the GM at the start of the Rot Vampire’s turn.

  • Misty Escape will close the actor sheet (if oppened) play the animation and delete the token from the map as it is no longer nedeed.

  • Vampire Weaknesses have three activities:

    • Harmed by Running Water will apply 20 acid damage to the vampire when used.

    • Sunlight Hypersensitivity applies 20 radiant damage and creates an Active Effect that gives the vampire disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks (if Midi is used). Remove the Active Effect when the vampire is no longer in sunlight.

    • Stake to the Heart creates an Active Effect that applies the Paralyzed condition.

  • Rotting Claw has three activities:

    • Attack: Used to attack with the claw and apply damage to the target creature.

    • Save: Must be used after a successful Rotting Claw attack. If the target fails the saving throw, it becomes poisoned.

    • Grapple Attack: Use this activity to attack and grapple a creature instead of dealing damage.

  • Infectious Bite can only be used on a creature that is grappled, prone, or incapacitated. This ability uses a Midi flag to reduce the target’s maximum hit points. If the Rot Vampire bites the same target multiple times, the effect is cumulative. Healing is applied automatically using BLFX.

Zombie

  • Undead Fortitude. The GM is responsible for calculating the saving throw DC, rolling, and deciding whether the zombie dies or drops to 1 hit point.
    One easy method is to check the chat for the damage dealt to the zombie, then use the Save activity of the ability (note that the total DC must be computed manually, as the activity has a fixed DC of 5). On a successful save, use the Heal activity to add 1 hit point to the zombie.

  • Death Burst. This ability should be triggered by the GM after the zombie’s death.

Maps

  • Maps main regions (to view them on the map, use the Region Controls button from the left panel):

    • Teleport Region: Teleports players to the next map.

    • Pause Before Spore Fungi Trap: Triggers the game to pause when a player-controlled token approaches within approximately 10 feet of a mushroom. This allows the GM to prompt the player for a Perception check before they enter the trap area. After the first player-controlled token enters this region, the pause behavior will be disabled automatically (meaning the next player will not trigger a pause).

    • Spore Fungi Trap: While enabled, this region automatically triggers a Constitution saving throw when a player-controlled token (not an NPC) enters the region (approximately 5 feet from the mushroom). The GM should disable this region after the first player triggers the trap, especially if the trap was triggered at a distance or if the players choose to carefully move around the mushrooms. Otherwise, the trap will continue triggering for each player who enters the region.

Macros for GM

  • @UUID[Macro.2BmPMdoDw1nASOsy]{Enable/Disable Regions}

    • Usable on all maps. This macro enables or disables region behaviors. For example, it can activate or deactivate the teleport and trap regions.

  • @UUID[Macro.iw1gMkKVPYn66bLN]{Summon Token}

    • Usable on all maps. This macro allows the GM to summon specific creatures onto the active map. You can choose whether the summoned token is visible or invisible to players, for example, if a creature manages to sneak up and perform a surprise attack near a player.

Other Mechanics

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.6MjN0PWhxvQ0aKjF.JournalEntryPage.UW2t4KS8ZS6I0MWx]{Bloodseeker's Vengeance Mechanics}

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
The combat difficulty of this encounter can vary and depends on factors such as the level of the player characters, their magic items, the size of the group, the environment, the number of enemies, and the Challenge Rating of each enemy.

The adventure is designed for a group of 4 player characters of levels 6-7 but can be adjusted for other levels.

The easiest way to adjust the difficulty of the encounters is by changing the hit points, armor or the damage of the monsters.

INTRODUCTION.name: INTRODUCTION
INTRODUCTION.text: The Hunger Beneath is a one-shot adventure for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition, designed for characters of levels 6–7. It is intended to be completed in 4 to 5 hours. While the story is set in Underdark, it can easily be adapted to any subterranean environment, such as caverns, ruins, or dungeon complexes.

ADVENTURE SUMMARY.name: ADVENTURE SUMMARY
ADVENTURE SUMMARY.text:
Long ago, a drow noble, once the consort of a drow priestess, embraced vampirism in an attempt to seize greater power. When he tried to raise an undead army and challenge the authority of his own people, he was defeated and imprisoned by the priestess within a crypt, sealed using arcane glyphs and blood rituals.

Now, a group of drow has begun excavating the ancient site, believing lost power lies buried within. They have used enslaved surface villagers to assist in the dig. In doing so, they have disturbed the vampire's prison. Over the centuries, exposure to necrotic spores and environmental decay has transformed the vampire into a feral creature driven primarily by hunger and instinct.

The Party’s Mission

The party must investigate reports of missing villagers and descends into the fungal abyss, where they discover survivors, scarred, terrified, and hunted. The adventurers must navigate the rot-choked ruins, uncover the truth, and decide whether they will flee, fight, or attempt to seal the creature again... if such a thing is still possible.

ADVENTURE HOOKS.name: ADVENTURE HOOKS
ADVENTURE HOOKS.text:
1. The Descent Begins

At the end of A Trail into the Dark, the party can choose to either return and report their findings or descend deeper to track the drow and search for survivors.

If they choose to return and report, the party is instructed by Sir Roderik Graut von Alaggar to locate and recover any surviving individuals. In order to present the matter formally before the Court, reliable evidence is required, ideally in the form of live witnesses. The party is tasked with descending into the Chasm to conduct a search and rescue operation and gather further information.

Either way, read the following to the players:

“Darkness surrounds you as you begin your descent into the chasm. The narrow trail clings to the steep granite wall, winding downward alongside a vast, yawning abyss. Cold water drips from above, slickening the stone beneath your feet and making every step feel precarious.

2. Silent Hamlet

The adventurers arrive at a small hamlet where all the inhabitants appear to have vanished. Only animals remain, several lying dead on the road, slashed or pierced by arrows although no arrows can be found. The adventurers must investigate to uncover what happened to the missing villagers.

POST-ENCOUNTER.name: POST-ENCOUNTER
POST-ENCOUNTER.text: If the party defeats the vampire, they can return to the surface or to their patron (Sir Roderik or another authority) and present any surviving individuals, relics, and information as proof that the threat has been eliminated. If the party chooses to flee instead, they are still able to report their findings, but their reputation may suffer for failing to fully contain the danger.

FUNGAL CAVERN.name: FUNGAL CAVERN
FUNGAL CAVERN.text:
Fungal Cavern

Description

This underground cavern is alive with oversized bioluminescent fungal clusters, casting dim green and yellow light throughout the cave. The terrain is layered in natural stone steps, creating a gradual descent from the northwest to the southeast, forming irregular ledges and slopes throughout the chamber.

“After some time navigating the treacherous path, a faint glow begins to appear ahead, lichen and tiny mushroom spores emit a soft green and yellow light, gently illuminating the way forward. The trail eventually levels out, guiding you into a narrow tunnel where sound is swallowed by the stone and silence presses in on all sides.

In the stillness of the deep, even your breathing seems too loud. At last, after what feels like an eternity, the path opens into a cavern, where scattered oversized fungi emit a dim light that illuminates the cave. The air is thick with a fungal mist, carrying a putrid smell.

In a dark corner, you see a man in rags, hunched over and clutching his knees, whispering to himself.”

Encounters & Challenges

Brant - The Broken Survivor

In a dark corner of the cavern, half-lost in fog and shadow, the party spots a man huddled against the stone. His clothes are torn and filthy, and he is curled up tightly, rocking gently, muttering incoherently to himself. If the party approach, he begins to claw at the wall in frantic desperation, terror plain in his wide, darting eyes. However, if the party carries a light source, the man flinches at first, but slowly begins to settle, blinking at the glow as though recognizing it through a haze.

A calm approach and a gentle tone may coax him into stillness. A successful [[/check per 12]] check causes him to uncurl slightly, resuming his murmured ramblings. His words are scattered and haunting:

“The shadow was moving all around us…”
“Hungry… always hungry…”
“Eyes like sharp needles, sparkling in the dark…”

Party Manages to Calm Brant:

The man’s name is Brant, though he cannot recall it unless aided magically or pulled back from the edge of madness. If Lesser Restoration is cast on him, he begins to recover his senses. His breathing slows, and he sits upright, still dazed, but coherent enough to speak. He asks softly for water and food, and once given comfort, he shares what he knows:

“My name is Brant… and I escaped. Barely. You’ve come too late, most of us are dead… captors and prisoners alike. The shadow is hungry. I must keep moving. If I stay still too long, it will come for me.”

If asked for more information, he will say:

“We were digging… forced to. At first it was just ruins. Old stones, carvings. But then they breached a wall. A deeper one. We were never allowed inside. The ones the dark elves took… they never came back. Neither did the elves. Only the shadow returned. It killed everything. Everyone. If anyone is still alive, they won’t be for long… I ran. But behind me, there were screams… then silence.”

Party Does Not Manage to Calm Brant:

If the party has no access to magic, a [[/check per intimidation 15]] check can coax a frightened version of this tale from him. In that case, Brant remains curled in on himself, glancing over his shoulder with fearful, accusing eyes. With a trembling voice he whispers pointing at the exit at the other side of the cave:

“The shadow is coming… There’s nothing behind us now, just blood and screams. The walls… covered in it. The dark… the dark is alive. We’ll all die here.”

GM Notes

To preserve the intended atmosphere and gameplay balance, it is essential that the darkness levels remain as designed. For the best experience, please ensure that the following setting is applied to each scene: Darkness Level: 0.85 (you can use this @UUID[Macro.A4Uozvru0UwypVC0]{macro} to update the darkness level on all scenes from this adventure).

The scene is Globally Illuminated with dim light. All characters can see the environment and objects on the map without requiring additional light sources.

Hint Mechanic (optional):
The GM may prompt any players proficient in Arcana or Medicine to make a DC 13 skill check. On success, subtly suggest that casting Lesser Restoration could help treat Brant’s condition.

Rewarding Initiative (optional):
If players cast Lesser Restoration without prompting, reward their initiative by granting the party advantage on their next Perception check when the vampire approaches, as Brant’s improved clarity allows him to warn them more effectively.

The Rot Vampire - Combat Encounter

As soon as the man finishes speaking, initiate the Vampire Ambush and use the macro to summon the vampire. It will fight until is forced into mist form.

@Embed[JournalEntry.1O2CFTLNziprna5I.JournalEntryPage.h8zrfEoDUmpZzYbS caption=false cite=false]

On Success:

If a character succeeds the Perception check, the GM narrates the following:

“You see something that moves in the dark, just at the edge of your vision. It crawls along the wall with unnatural ease, weaving between rocks and mushrooms. For a moment, the creature freezes, neither fully crouching nor fully standing, shrouded in shadow. Two sharp red eyes lock onto you. And then, in a blink, it’s upon you, mouth agape, full of sharp teeth, black claws slashing through the air as it tries to grab you.”

Roll initiative and begin combat. On his turn Brant will attempts to hide and flee into the darkness.

On Fail:

If the Perception roll fails, the GM can narrate:

“A dark shape detaches from the ceiling, silent, fluid, and unseen behind the man. In a blink, claws flash and fangs sink deep as his head is wrenched to the side. The creature's mouth fastens onto the exposed neck with terrifying precision. Its eyes, filled with hunger, lock onto you as Brant’s body goes limp. His skin grays and shrivels in seconds, a wet gurgle escaping his throat before he collapses in a lifeless heap. The creature tosses him aside like discarded meat, licks the blood from its jaws, then crouches low and charges with a feral growl.”

After combat:

When reduced to 0 HP, the vampire uses Misty Escape to assume mist form and flee to its resting location.

“For a moment you have time to observe the hacked, fallen body of the creature that attacked you, a humanoid shape with vaguely human features. But before you can act, the body begins to dissolve into a fine mist. It curls through the air like smoke slithering across the cavern floor toward the exit.”

If Brant survives and regains his senses, he offers to join the party and guide them to the dig site.

"You… you killed it," Brant murmurs with his eyes wide with disbelief.

If Brant does not survive it will rise as a zombie after one minute:

"Brant lies on the cave floor, his face frozen in a grimace of death. As you prepare to leave, his body begins to twitch, subtle at first, then violently convulsing. Just as suddenly, it goes still.

Then, he begins to rise. Flesh peels and melts away from his face, drawing back around the mouth, stretching wide, too wide, as if reshaping itself for the bite to come."

Hazards

ROPE BRIDGE.name: ROPE BRIDGE
ROPE BRIDGE.text:
Rope Bridge

Description

A thick green fog fills the cavern. A narrow rope bridge stretches across a wide chasm, swaying gently between two rocky ledges. Dim light glows from clusters of mushrooms scattered throughout the area, casting small circles of illumination in the otherwise murky surroundings. The walls and ground are rough and uneven, marked by cracks, outcroppings, and slick patches from constant dripping moisture.

GM Notes

To preserve the intended atmosphere and gameplay balance, it is essential that the darkness levels remain as designed. For the best experience, please ensure that the following setting is applied to each scene: Darkness Level: 1 (you can use this @UUID[Macro.A4Uozvru0UwypVC0]{macro} to update the darkness level on all scenes from this adventure).

This scene Global Illumination is turned off. The only sources of light are the scattered bioluminescent mushrooms. Characters with Darkvision can see in shades of black and white. Characters without Darkvision, such as humans, require a torch or lamp to see. If the BLFX module is installed, the GM may equip characters with built-in torches, lamps, or any standard light source from the SRD or PHB. When used, these items provide functional illumination in the scene.

Hazzards

The bridge is unstable and requires a [[/check acr 12]] check to cross safely.

Running or fighting on the bridge requires a [[/check acr 15]].

Medium or heavy armor imposes disadvantage on the check unless magical.

Failure results in a 40ft fall into the chasm taking [[/damage 4d6 bludgeoning]] damage.

GM Notes

This map becomes more relevant the second time the party arrives here, later in the adventure, if they choose to flee instead of confronting the vampire in its lair. The vampire will attempt to ambush them during their retreat.

ALTAR CHAMBER.name: ALTAR CHAMBER
ALTAR CHAMBER.text:
Altar Chamber

Description

On the other side of the bridge, a narrow tunnel leads to what appears to be an ancient temple structure. To the right of the entrance, rough steps carved into the rock ascend toward what looks like an altar. Rubble blocks the path both at the base and top of the stairs, making traversal difficult terrain.

Near the center of the site, the natural earth has been dug out and cleared to reveal elegant stone flooring, framed by four tall columns, one of which lies shattered, its broken pieces scattered across the room. This central area has been transformed into a campsite. Tents and tattered sleeping bags lie abandoned around the chamber.

To the right, a second set of stone steps provides another path up to the altar, where a broken horned, devilish statue lies in ruins. To the left, a section of the wall has been broken through, revealing a pair of heavy wooden doors engraved with faded symbols. The doors now lie broken on the ground among the rubble. Beyond them, the corridor disappears into total darkness.

Scattered along the edges of the room and growing in cracks between the stones are clusters of bioluminescent mushrooms. Their soft green and yellow glow casts faint pools of light across the floor, blending with the dying embers of a small campfire in the center, a brazier near the altar, and four wall-mounted lamps.

GM Notes

To preserve the intended atmosphere and gameplay balance, it is essential that the darkness levels remain as designed. For the best experience, please ensure that the following setting is applied to each scene: Darkness Level: 1 (you can use this @UUID[Macro.A4Uozvru0UwypVC0]{macro} to update the darkness level on all scenes from this adventure).

In this scene, Global Illumination is turned off, but there is plenty of light from wall lamps and bioluminescent mushrooms. A character without Darkvision still requires a light source to see everything clearly. If the BLFX module is installed, the GM may equip characters with built-in torches, lamps, or any standard light source from the SRD or PHB. When used, these items provide functional illumination in the scene.

Encounters & Challenges

A successful [[/check inv 12]] check reveals bloodstains and splatters throughout the area, no more than a day old, as well as a door on the far side of the room that appears to be barred from the inside.

The GM can read:

On closer inspection, blood is almost everywhere. Trails of bloody handprints stretch across the walls, and dark smears on the floor suggest that bloodied bodies were dragged across the room, but none of the trails reach the altar at the top of the stairs. On the far side of the room, there is a door that appears to be barred from the inside.

Survivors have barricaded themselves inside the room, but they refuse to open the door, convinced it’s a trick played by the vampire. A successful [[/check per 18]] check will convince them to unlock it. If Brant is present, he can vouch for the party and assist with the check, granting advantage.

If the party chooses to force the door:

  • The door is reinforced from the inside with crates, barrels, and other heavy objects.

  • Breaking it down requires a [[/check ath 22]] check.

  • Alternatively, it can be carefully dismantled with a [[/tool thief dex 20]] check, though this may take several minutes.

Behind the barricade, the party finds six survivors, all of them visibly exhausted. Their clothes are torn, and their bodies show signs of prolonged stress, with scratches, bruises, and the haunted expressions of those who have barely survived. The drow remains especially cautious, silently observing the group.

The room appears to be a storeroom, cluttered with food and supplies that were likely pillaged from the attacked villages. Scattered among the crates and barrels are tools, cloth, lanterns, coils of rope, crossbow bolts and some weapons. Near the back of the room lies a disorganized collection of unearthed artifacts, broken statues, faded scrolls, and cracked holy symbols. The party may collect items from the storeroom worth a total of 300 GP.

If questioned, the surviving villagers can offer only limited information. Most of the group was killed or dragged away before anyone could react, and the remaining survivors barely managed to barricade themselves inside the storeroom:

"It was like the shadows grabbed them and dragged them away, we barely had time to scream."

"It was all around us. We didn’t know where the next attack would come from... all we could do was run for our lives."

"We couldn’t save them, there was no time. Everything happened so fast!"

If Brant survived the earlier encounter, he excitedly tells the others about how the party defeated the creature, describing how it melted into mist before his very eyes.

The drow survivor, however, remains silent, frequently glancing toward the broken doors on the left side of the room. If asked what he knows, he initially refuses to respond. A successful [[/check charisma intimidation persuasion 13]] check (and the ability to speak Undercommon, Elvish, or use Comprehend Languages) will convince him to share what little he knows:

"We’re told scary tales of beings like this when we’re children, but I’d never seen one until now. There’s a story from hundred of years ago, about a duergar settlement wiped out completely by a single one of these things. Who knows... maybe it’s the same one. You surface dwellers call them vampires."

If asked why the drow were excavating the site, he will respond:

"Rumors spoke of power buried here, old relics, forgotten magic, maybe even the remains of ancient gods. None of us were told what really lay beneath..."

If left unguarded or distracted, the drow will try to escape at the first chance he gets.

CRYPT LAIR.name: CRYPT LAIR
CRYPT LAIR.text:
Crypt Lair

Description

If the party follows the broken wall, they reach a narrow, descending tunnel. Mist fills the area. Any source of illumination reveals faded murals along the tunnel walls.

The GM may read:

"The first mural depicts a dark subterranean city under siege. A regal drow priestess stands beside her consort, a slender drow in ornate crimson armor. His eyes are narrow and luminous, and his open mouth reveals sharp, elongated canines. Alongside other noble drow and elite warriors, the two watch in silence as the streets below are consumed by destruction. Beneath them, his army of twisted humanoid figures with hollow eyes and bloodied mouths ravages the city, tearing down its defenders and feasting on their remains."

"The next mural shows the aftermath. The red-armored drow stands in the heart of the ruined city, arms outstretched as the dead rise around him. Corpses crawl from the rubble to join his growing army. The priestess and other drow leaders stand apart, watching from a distance. Their faces are tense and uncertain. Other murals nearby depict similar scenes: settlements in ruin, each one overwhelmed by the same undead horde."

"Further down the corridor, another mural reveals itself. The red-armored figure now leads a vast horde of undead. Opposing him are the dark elf priestess and her warriors, armed and ready for battle."

"Another mural follows. The red-armored vampire is brought to his knees, bound in glowing chains of magic. The priestess stands before him once more, delivering judgment. Her gaze is cold, but pained."

"In the next image, the vampire remains chained, silently watching as workers construct a prison of stone and magic. He does not struggle, he only watches."

"A sixth mural depicts the priestess alone beside a massive stone coffin, sealed with chains and glowing symbols. Her hand rests on the lid. Her face is weary, not with age, but with burden."

"At the end of the tunnel, the final mural shows the drow priestess standing before the altar at the entrance, pouring a red liquid, likely the vampire’s blood, into a demonic fountain positioned in front of the altar. From the altar, arcane energy flows outward and downward, forming a web of glowing red sigils that spread across geometric patterns carved into the floor. The energy reaches the entrance to the crypt, where a set of heavy double doors is shown being consumed and sealed shut by this force."

The party steps into a short, wide corridor that opens onto a high terrace. Stairs carved into the solid rock descend on both sides, leading down to a spacious chamber. In the center of the room rests a large stone sarcophagus, covered in arcane symbols. It was once bound in chains, but now lies open, the chains scattered loosely around it. Torch holders are set along the walls, though none are lit, and empty braziers stand cold near the base of the stairs. Clusters of bioluminescent mushrooms have taken root in cracks along the floor and walls, barely illuminates the room.

The room is swarming with zombies, former villagers and drow, now standing guard around the vampire’s resting place. They attack the party as soon as they become aware of their presence.

Optional: If the party examines the vampire's stone sarcophagus, they find a strange, sinister-looking shortbow inside (Bloodseeker's Vengeance). The shortbow is carved with patterns resembling veins and arteries along its limbs.

GM Notes

To preserve the intended atmosphere and gameplay balance, it is essential that the darkness levels remain as designed. For the best experience, please ensure that the following setting is applied to each scene: Darkness Level: 1 (you can use this @UUID[Macro.A4Uozvru0UwypVC0]{macro} to update the darkness level on all scenes from this adventure).

This scene Global Illumination is turned off. The only sources of light are the scattered bioluminescent mushrooms. Characters with Darkvision can see in shades of black and white. Characters without Darkvision, such as humans, require a torch or lamp to see. If the BLFX module is installed, the GM may equip characters with built-in torches, lamps, or any standard light source from the SRD or PHB. When used, these items provide functional illumination in the scene.

Encounters & Challenges

The Vampire Resting Place - Combat Encounter

If the party reaches the chamber within an hour of their initial encounter, the vampire is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.xnSV5hLJIMaTABXP]{Paralyzed} inside the stone coffin.

If more than an hour has passed, the vampire has reformed and fully regenerated. Here, he will fight until is forced into mist form.

@Embed[JournalEntry.ZpQgH8ExYasZDzpH.JournalEntryPage.h8zrfEoDUmpZzYbS caption=false cite=false]

GM Notes

The vampire cannot be permanently killed, especially in this environment. If it drops to 0 Hit Points outside its resting place, it uses Misty Escape to become mist. While it has 0 Hit Points in mist form, it cannot return to its vampire form and must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed.

Once it reaches its resting place, it reforms but remains @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.xnSV5hLJIMaTABXP]{Paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 Hit Point. After spending 1 hour in the resting place, it regains 1 Hit Point and the Paralyzed condition ends.

If the party chose to fight the vampire again, the most favorable outcome is to incapacitate him in its resting place using a wooden stake. While paralyzed, the GM may allow the vampire to be permanently destroyed through specific means, such as severing its head or performing a powerful spell or ritual.

Refer to the table below for information that can be revealed to the party:

Mechanics.name: Mechanics
Mechanics.text:
Generic

  1. To use this item, you must equip and attune to it.

  2. Before being equipped to a Player or an NPC, the item's name can be modified. Once it has been equipped, further renaming is not advised.

  3. For resource optimization, the visual effect of Bloodforged Arrows will only create a blood pool once for a given target.

  4. The base damage of the item is configurable from the Item Details tab. Extra necrotic damage is also configurable from the Item Activities.

  5. The hit point sacrifice caused by Bloodforged Arrows inflicts true damage. Creatures using the arrow will always sustain this damage, regardless of any damage resistances.

  6. While the weapon is attuned and equipped, the curses cannot be removed or mitigated by any means. Once the weapon is either unattuned or unequipped, the curses dissipate entirely and their effects vanish.

  7. If the Midi module is active, using any of the "Sacrifice" attack activities (Sacrifice 2HP, 4HP, 6HP, or 8HP) will automatically trigger a healing roll (Heal (1d6)) and apply the result to the item's owner.

  8. The activity Curse of the Blood Reaper (Attack) is the only attack that does not trigger an automatic healing roll, even if the Midi module is active.

  9. There is a separate activity for the curse Curse of the Blood Reaper (Attack) which handles the forced shot when a natural 20 is rolled. This activity is provided in case the GM wishes to adapt the mechanics, such as increasing the self-inflicted damage (e.g., 16 hit points instead of 8).

  10. The item includes the following Active Effects:

    • Curse of Macabre Attraction. This effect visually represents the curse of the same name. It also applies vulnerability to necrotic damage. It is automatically removed when the bow is unattuned.

    • Bloodforged Pool. This effect is applied to the target creature after being hit by a blood arrow. It is responsible for the pool of blood animation at the target's feet. When this effect expires or is removed, the animation will also be deleted. This effect's name must not be changed.

    • Curse of the Blood Reaper. This effect is applied to the owner of the bow after failing the DC 15 Wisdom saving throw triggered by a critical hit. While this effect is active, the player must use the activity Curse of the Blood Reaper (Attack).

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text:
@UUID[JournalEntry.AFbe6mpfAGEy1cNR]

Oversized, bioluminescent mushrooms are highly reactive to nearby movement.

When a creature moves within 5ft of a glowing mushroom for the first time, the mushroom reflexively releases a cloud of noxious spores into the air.

Each creature within 5ft of the mushroom must succeed on a [[/save con 13]] saving throw or is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.lq3TRI6ZlED8ABMx]for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, it also hallucinates, perceiving harmless shapes as threats or vice versa (GM discretion). The creature may repeat the save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the creature is unaffected.

A character inspecting the mushrooms with a [[/skill nature 13]] or [[/skill perception 15]] check can detect the spore sacs clustered near the caps.

A character can move carefully around the mushrooms with a [[/skill stealth acrobatics 15]] check to avoid disturbing them.

Hitting the mushrooms from a distance causes them to release spores prematurely in a harmless puff, rendering them inert.

GM Notes: When a player approaches the trap area, the game will automatically pause, allowing the GM to prompt the closest player to make a Perception check to spot the trap. If the players successfully disarm the trap, the GM should also disable it using the UI below. If the trap is not disabled, then each player who enters the trap area will trigger it. The saving throw and Poisoned condition are all handled automatically for the token that enters the trap area.
Important: The region before the trap will only trigger the game to pause if a player-controlled token enters it.

Detailed region descriptions are available in the @UUID[JournalEntry.IGXiedqe34DV2mIK.JournalEntryPage.uRfU19jUfr70ti2u]{Mechanics} section.

Use this @UUID[Macro.2BmPMdoDw1nASOsy]{Interactive Map Features UI} to enable or disable the poison gas trap.

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text:
@UUID[JournalEntry.ZpQgH8ExYasZDzpH]

If more than an hour has passed since the initial encounter in the Fungal Cavern, where it was forced into mist form, the vampire has fully regenerated and taken physical form once more. Now more cautious, it resumes its hunt, stalking the party from the shadows. It employs hit-and-run tactics, targeting the most vulnerable members of the group, especially the remaining survivors.

On each zone (map) the party enters the vampire will ambush. For every hour, short rest, or long rest, roll a [[/roll 1d6]]. On a result of 5 or 6, the vampire ambushes the party again.

The vampire rolls [[/check skill=stealth]]. Compare against the party’s Perception to determine if they’re surprised.

The vampire appears from a concealed space or ceiling, targets one survivor NPC, and uses its movement followed by a Multiattack (Claws + Bite). It then attempts to retreat, using its Shadow Drift ability.

He will continue using hit-and-run tactics until the party leaves the Fungal Cavern, or until it is immobilized or forced into mist form.

A Trail into the Dark.name: A Trail into the Dark
A Trail into the Dark.description:
A Trail into the Dark is a Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition one-shot adventure designed for characters of levels 6-7. It is intended to be completed in 3-4 hours. In the southern reaches of Sir Roderik Graut von Alaggar’s domain, villages have been mysteriously emptied and their people vanished without a trace. The players are tasked with investigating the cause of these disappearances.

Their search leads them to a concealed cavern system at the edge of the Underdark. Inside, they discover that drow raiders have been abducting surface dwellers for use as forced labor in service to their matriarch's ambitions. The caverns are heavily webbed and guarded, with a lurking drider using the area as its hunting ground. Players must navigate hazards and rescue any surviving captives.

The adventure combines investigation, exploration, and tactical combat, and concludes with the players returning to report their findings, though deeper dangers may still lie below.
A Trail into the Dark.caption: A Trail into the Dark Encounter

Chainweaver Bracer.name: Chainweaver Bracer
Chainweaver Bracer.description:
Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement)

“The elven adventurer pointed her hand at the brute blocking the door. A shining chain burst forth from her bracer and wrapped around the brute, dragging him to the ground. "Let's have a conversation" she said calmly.”

This bracer has a magical chain coiled around it that glows with a faint magical energy. A single gem is affixed to it. When the gem is pressed, the chain extends out from the bracer, allowing you to grab a creature.

This item has 2 charges. It regains expended charges after a short rest. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to use the bracer chain and attempt to grab and pull a creature 40ft away toward you. The target must make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=16 format=long]]. On a failure, it is pulled toward you and becomes @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cSVcyZyNe2iG1fIc]{Restrained} until the start of your next turn.

Void Vortex.name: Void Vortex
Void Vortex.description:
Weapon (longbow), rare (requires attunement)

"You remain within or behind or beyond or above, invisible, out of existence, indifferent, but out of nothing, everything."

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Infinite Arrows. You do not require ammunition to fire this bow. The arrows are magical and deal force damage.

Vortex Arrow (Active Ability). As an action, you must say the activation phrase "The Void of the Universe will consume you!" to materialize a vortex arrow. Choose a point within the weapon's normal range where the arrow will land. The arrow causes gravity to collapse, creating a vortex which bursts shortly after its formation, dealing [[/r 4d8]] force damage in a 20ft radius. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to your Spellcasting ability. On a failed save, the creature takes full damage and on a success it takes half as much damage.

After using this ability, the bow will enter a state of chaotic vibration and you will not be able to use this ability until a day has passed.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

materials.value: A bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

materials.value: Bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

Faerie Fire.description:
Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being invisible.

Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being invisible.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Multiattack. The [[lookup @name upercase]] makes three attacks, either with its longsword or its longbow. It can replace one of those attacks with a bite attack.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: the [[lookup @name upercase]] has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to sleep.

Innate Spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
Innate Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name uperrcase]]'s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights

1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name upercase]] has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Shortsword.name: Shortsword
Shortsword.description: A medium sized blade with a firm crossguard and a leather-wrapped handle. A versatile weapon which makes up in versatility what it lacks in reach.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

materials.value: A bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

Chainweaver Bracer v1.name: Chainweaver Bracer v1
Chainweaver Bracer v1.description:
Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement)

“The elven adventurer pointed her hand at the brute blocking the door. A shining chain burst forth from her bracer and wrapped around the brute, dragging him to the ground. "Let's have a conversation" she said calmly.”

This bracer has a magical chain coiled around it that glows with a faint magical energy. A single gem is affixed to it. When the gem is pressed, the chain extends out from the bracer, allowing you to grab a creature.

This item has 2 charges. It regains expended charges after a short rest. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to use the bracer chain and attempt to grab and pull a creature 40ft away toward you. The target must make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=16 format=long]]. On a failure, it is pulled toward you and becomes @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cSVcyZyNe2iG1fIc]{Restrained} until the start of your next turn.

Toyama’s Madness (Rare) v1.name: Toyama’s Madness (Rare) v1
Toyama’s Madness (Rare) v1.description:
Weapon (flail), rare (requires attunement)

“Raging like a madman, the warrior swung the flail in a large arc, hitting the hobgoblin. The echo of a maddening chorus of laughing men burst forth and the eyes of the creature opened in a terrified expression, his body stiff like a board, his hand unable to hold onto his weapon which fell on the ground with a clang. Grinning, the warrior raised the flail again...”

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This flail has a whimsical but well crafted design. The heads of the flail have a grotesque, exaggerated laughing face on each side, hanging at the end of a long chain. On a successful hit, an echoing cacophony of laughter bursts out of the weapon striking deep in the mind of the target.

Madness Echo. Whenever you score a critical hit, the target must make a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes [[/r 1d8]] psychic damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not incapacitated.

Void Vortex (Rare) v1.description:

"You remain within or behind or beyond or above, invisible, out of existence, indifferent, but out of nothing, everything."

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Infinite Arrows. You do not require ammunition to fire this bow. The arrows are magical and deal force damage.

Choose a point within the weapon's normal range where the arrow will land. The arrow causes gravity to collapse, creating a vortex which bursts shortly after its formation, dealing [[/r 4d8]] force damage in a 20ft radius. On a failed save, the creature takes full damage and on a success it takes half as much damage.

MECHANICS.name: MECHANICS
MECHANICS.text:
How To Enable Map Notes

Animations (Optional)

To enable animations for abilities, spells and magic items, install the BLFX Assets & Animation Editor Premium module.

Drider & Drow

  • When casting Dancing Lights, you can choose between one Medium light or four Tiny lights. If using four lights, the GM should ensure that each light remains within 20 feet of another.

  • After attacking with a weapon, the token image automatically flips to face the target token.

  • The drow hand crossbow has an activity (Save) that triggers a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, which can apply the Poisoned condition. It also has an activity for the Unconscious condition (if the saving throw fails by 5 or more).
    If you want to give the crossbow to players, you need to delete the Save and Unconscious activities.

Maps

  • On The Flooded Cavern there are three regions in the southern part of the map:

    • Pause Before Trap region which will pause the game once a player enter the region.

    • Trap region is designed for a poison gas trap.

    • Entrance region teleports players to the second map.

  • To view the regions, use the Region Controls button on the left panel.
    By default, all regions are enabled, but the GM can customize this either using the provided macros or by directly enabling/disabling the region behaviors.

Macros for GM

  • @UUID[Macro.0aHzFNGk2IK2GxFc]{Enable/Disable Regions}

    • Usable on all maps. This macro enables or disables region behaviors. For example, it can activate or deactivate the teleport and poison gas trap regions.

  • @UUID[Macro.QGRTR0lD33RuewZW]{Tokens Damage}

    • A useful tool for quickly applying damage to selected tokens. The Saving Throw DC and Ability fields are optional. If left blank, the selected tokens will always take full damage. This macro is usable on all maps and is particularly helpful when a creature falls into the chasm.

  • @UUID[Macro.grY6jrgDpNMsbroI]{Update Tiles}

    • Use this to destroy web bridges on The Swallowing Chasm. Choose the damage type, check the damaged webs, and press Update.

Other Mechanics

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.n6RMOBYzpLNmNF2R.JournalEntryPage.nVllD96kvxhmdVwU]{Chainweaver Bracer}
