DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
The combat difficulty of this encounter can vary and depends on factors such as the level of the player characters, their magic items, the size of the group, the environment, the number of enemies, and the Challenge Rating of each enemy.

The adventure is designed for a group of 4 player characters of levels 6-7 but can be adjusted for other levels.

The easiest way to adjust the difficulty of the encounters is by changing the hit points, armor or the damage of the monsters.

INTRODUCTION.name: INTRODUCTION
INTRODUCTION.text: A Trail into the Dark is a Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition one-shot adventure designed for characters of levels 6-7. It is intended to be completed in 3-4 hours and takes place in caverns at the entrance to the Underdark.

ADVENTURE SUMMARY.name: ADVENTURE SUMMARY
ADVENTURE SUMMARY.text:
A sinister threat from the depths of the Underdark has begun terrorizing the southern lands of Sir Roderik Graut von Alaggar. Villages have been systematically attacked and left devoid of human bodies, raising questions about the fate of the inhabitants. Investigating these events, adventurers uncover evidence of drow involvement and their purpose: abducting surface dwellers to serve as forced labor for their matriarch’s ambitions.

The Party’s Mission

The party must investigate who or what is attacking the villages and kidnapping the people and find out the reasons behind these nocturnal attacks.

ADVENTURE HOOKS.name: ADVENTURE HOOKS
ADVENTURE HOOKS.text:
1. A Noble's Plea

The local noble, Sir Roderik Graut von Alaggar urgently summons adventurers to help him with some troubling issues. While his forces battle orcs in the north, another more insidious enemy is hitting his domain from the south silently razed entire hamlets with just a few killed and most of them disappearing entirely. The adventurers must identify those responsible for abducting villagers, and uncover their motives.

2. Silent Hamlet

The adventurers arrive at a small hamlet where all the inhabitants appear to have vanished. Only animals remain, several lying dead on the road, slashed or pierced by arrows although no arrows can be found. The adventurers must investigate to uncover what happened to the missing villagers.

THE HIDDEN ENTRANCE.name: THE HIDDEN ENTRANCE
THE HIDDEN ENTRANCE.text:
The Hidden Entrance

Starting their investigation, the party finds a small hamlet completely destroyed. Houses are burned down, with no sign of human bodies or clear evidence of fatalities. Broken doors hang loosely, having been forced open from the outside, and tables lie overturned. Trails indicate villagers were dragged towards the middle of the settlement.

Numerous tracks lead away into the nearby forest. Following these tracks through the woods for several hours eventually leads the adventurers to a waterfall cascading down a stone cliff. A keen eye notices a cave entrance concealed behind the dense curtain of water.

THE FLOODED CAVERN.name: THE FLOODED CAVERN
THE FLOODED CAVERN.text:
The Flooded Cavern

Description

This naturally formed cave, partially flooded by clear water from the waterfall, has three large natural stone pillars in the middle. The water reaches a depth of up to 15ft in the deepest areas, and with careful observation, broken statues and scattered bones can be seen resting beneath the surface. Makeshift wooden walkways and platforms have been constructed around the pillars and along the cavern walls. Strange mushrooms, growing in scattered clusters, emit faint green and purple bioluminescent light, providing dim illumination throughout the cave. A narrow strip of rocky ground along the right side offers limited passage around the waterfall. Piles of lumber lie stacked in various locations, alongside empty animal cages stained with fresh blood splatters. At the far end of the cavern, a tunnel leads deeper into the darkness.

Encounters & Challenges

Six drow warriors are present in the cave, preparing for their next raid. If the adventurers manage to enter the cave unnoticed whether by hiding, swimming underwater, or using other stealthy methods they will observe the drow warriors engaged in conversation, unaware of the party’s presence. If any adventurer understands Undercommon, they can make out the following exchange:

“The last transport of surface dwellers was pitiful. The Matriarch will have our hides if we don’t bring more next time. And having to feed that abomination doesn’t make it any easier.”

GM Notes

To preserve the intended atmosphere and gameplay balance, it is essential that the darkness levels remain as designed. For the best experience, please ensure that the following setting is applied to each scene: Darkness Level: 0.65 (you can use this @UUID[Macro.UTTY232i5ROTxvmY]{macro} to update the darkness level on all scenes from this adventure).

At any point, if the players do something that could attract the drow’s attention, the GM can have the drow make a Perception check to spot them. If the check succeeds, the drow will immediately become hostile and initiate combat.

  • The drow may cast Dancing Lights to distract, Darkness to obscure vision, and Faerie Fire to reveal hidden or invisible enemies.

  • (Optional) One of the drow carries the @UUID[JournalEntry.n6RMOBYzpLNmNF2R]{Chainweaver Bracer}a magic item that the GM may choose to have the drow use during combat to restrain a player.

If the adventurers manage to capture a drow, a successful [[/check intimidation 14]] will reveal the following information provided at least one party member speaks Elvish or Undercommon:

The drow sneers: “We took those purposeless rabble and gave them purpose. They now serve greater beings and a greater cause—and nothing you do can bring them back. By now, they’ve met their fate. I will tell you no more.”

If questioned further, the drow refuses to answer.

If the players cast Speak with Dead on a fallen drow, the corpse draws a deep, sharp breath. Its eyes gloss over, and it turns its head slightly toward the interrogators, its expression almost one of disgust.

If asked why they attacked the villages:

“Muscle and bone were needed for a greater purpose in service to a great being.”

If asked where the missing people are:

“They walk the deep paths, driven by the whips of my kin and the piercing gaze of Lolth.”

If asked what lies ahead:

“Only the breath of death… and the pain of steel, claw, and fang.”

@Embed[JournalEntry.IQGTkHun0XpvZJCC.JournalEntryPage.dmJNVcAXiR9vR2K8 caption=false cite=false]

Hazards

@Embed[JournalEntry.xf9bG7UGhYcQFGEn.JournalEntryPage.h8zrfEoDUmpZzYbS caption=false cite=false]

THE SWALLOWING CHASM.name: THE SWALLOWING CHASM
THE SWALLOWING CHASM.text:
The Swallowing Chasm

Description

This cavern stretches across multiple chambers, connected by narrow web bridges suspended over a deep chasm. The darkness is broken only by the faint glow of a few scattered purple bioluminescent mushrooms, casting dim light across isolated patches of stone. A natural stone island stands in the center of the chasm, rising from the depths and connected to the surrounding ledges by thick spider webs. More webs cling to various parts of the cavern, stretching from ceiling to floor, linking stalagmites and spreading into the corners. Scattered cocoons, shredded cloth and bone fragments suggest that something dangerous calls this place home.

Encounters & Challenges

A Drider inhabits this cavern, lurking in the shadows.

If players succeed on a [[/check perception 12]] check, they notice the following:

“You hear a faint chittering sound first from one side, then the other. Something is moving above, hidden in the darkness of the high ceiling.”

If the check fails, the Drider, concealed in the shadows, makes a surprise attack with its bow.

When the creature crawls into view, you can describe it as it follows:

“A large, dark shape skitters rapidly across the ceiling. As it moves into the faint mushroom light, its monstrous form becomes visible. The torso is that of a deformed drow, bloated like a corpse, its skin covered in a shiny, chitinous carapace. Below, a bulbous spider body with long, spindly legs supports the creature. Its face is twisted and mutated, dotted with many small, red eyes. Patches of white hair hang limply from its scalp, and its pudgy cheeks are split by enormous spider fangs dripping with venom. It whispers something in a ragged voice.”

If any of the players understand Elvish or Undercommon, they hear the Drider say:

“You curs smell of my kin’s blood. You killed those weaklings before I could do it myself, so maybe I should thank you. But you look like you might help me with something better, ending this curse... or at least feeding my hunger for a little while.”

GM Notes

To preserve the intended atmosphere and gameplay balance, it is essential that the darkness levels remain as designed. For the best experience, please ensure that the following setting is applied to each scene: Darkness Level: 0.8 (you can use this @UUID[Macro.UTTY232i5ROTxvmY]{macro} to update the darkness level on all scenes from this adventure).

Drider Biography: Driders are feared and shunned by drow society, regarded as outcasts even lower than slaves. Drow who fail or defy the Spider Queen, Lolth, may be transformed into driders, stripped of their status, relationships, and worldly possessions. Though initially exiled from their cities, driders are sometimes tolerated if they return, serving as living examples of the consequences of failure. In some cases, drow even confine them to specific areas where they serve as a line of defense against intruders.

Driders hate the drow, and their greatest satisfaction often comes from slaying them. Occasionally, some drow may approach a drider with a task in exchange for a reward. However, the drow are notoriously treacherous and often set impossible expectations, with the drider usually ending up dead. Many driders anticipate betrayal and prepare contingencies to take as many drow with them as possible.

Magic Item (Optional): The Drider is equipped with the@UUID[JournalEntry.mQd3CKaPQIlPhAzh]{Void Vortex Longbow}. The GM may choose to use its abilities during combat.

Hazards

Falling into the Chasm

The chasm is 80ft deep. A creature that falls takes [[/damage 8d6 bludgeoning]] damage ([[/damage 1d6]] per 10ft fallen).

@Embed[JournalEntry.fC4kRfrxclaRO01h.JournalEntryPage.6pIIfyhXDYZadEXp caption=false cite=false]

Crossing the Chasm

Players may attempt to cross the chasm using the following methods:

Web Bridges:

  • Some webs act as narrow, suspended bridges.

  • Crossing the webs is considered difficult terrain.

@Embed[JournalEntry.jqTSoQza3BhudSze.JournalEntryPage.8IeQgiQoirLzNzYB caption=false cite=false]

Climbing the Walls:

  • The cavern walls are climbable with patches of webbing and stone outcroppings.

  • Requires a [[/check ath 14]] check to climb across a safe route.

  • Falling may occur on a failed check at the GM’s discretion.

Jumping Between Ledges:

  • If ledges are close enough (10ft or less), a player may attempt a running long jump.

  • A character can jump a number of feet equal to their Strength score with 10ft of movement.

  • Failing to reach the next ledge results in falling unless the character can grab an edge [[/save dex 13]].

Magic and other Solutions:

  • Spells like Misty Step, Spider Climb or Fly can be used.

  • Players may use rope and grapling hooks.

POST-ENCOUNTER.name: POST-ENCOUNTER
POST-ENCOUNTER.text:
Once the Drider is vanquished, a successful [[/check investigation 14]] check reveals a small cache of treasure tucked into a corner of one of the rear enclosures on the far side of the chasm. The hoard is partially hidden beneath thick spider webs. Among the webs, the adventurers also find two web wrapped humanoids, unconscious but alive.

Additionally, a successful [[/check survival 15]] check reveals faint trickles of blood and torn cloth fibers leading deeper into the chasm, suggesting that more prisoners have been taken into lower tunnels beyond this cave.

The survivors recount the events of a drow raid on their village, their journey to this cave, and how most of their group was taken further below, while a few were left behind to feed the Drider.

The adventurers must report their findings to Sir Roderik Graut von Alaggar with urgency, concluding this part of the quest.

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text:
We stayed here longer than we should’ve. The water keeps rising, and those glowing mushrooms make my skin crawl. Still, it was quiet, good enough to lay low for a while.

Tarn and the others handled the patrol last night. Four guards. One of them fought like a devil. Big, stubborn bastard with a strange flail that, every time it swung, made a sound like mad laughter. I recognized him. His name was Toyama. He was the one who held off that hobgoblin raid years ago. He saved me then but I was just a kid. Folk called him a hero after.

Didn’t matter in the end. They all went into the water.

We’re pulling out tonight. Too much heat. Too much bad luck. If anyone finds this... that man deserves a proper burial.

For GM.name: For GM
For GM.text:
@UUID[JournalEntry.IQGTkHun0XpvZJCC]{Handout: Old Journal}

Investigating the cave, with a successful [[/check inv 13]] reveals a hidden spot on the west wall containing an old journal. The journal appears to have been written by a bandit. It states that the group used the cave as a temporary hideout and fled after ambushing and disposing of a patrol of guards sent to find them.

If the adventurers dive underwater to recover the remains of the patrol, they will discover the magic item@UUID[JournalEntry.uDSIlR8Pn68BKJd1]{Toyama’s Madness}lying near one of the corpses.

Note: You can safely show this to players. They will only see the description.

Mechanics.name: Mechanics
Mechanics.text:
1. To use this item, you must equip and attune to it.

  2. Before being equipped to a Player or an NPC, the item's name can be modified. Once it has been equipped, further renaming is not advised. The active ability, Vortex Arrow, should always maintain its original name.

  3. For players who are not spellcasters, the DC for the Dexterity Saving Throw will be 8 + Proficiency Bonus.

  4. Targets that fail the Dexterity saving throw will automatically be pulled toward the center of the template if you are using Midi-QoL. If the Midi-QoL module is not active, the GM should manually roll a Dexterity saving throw for all creatures within the template and apply the Incapacitated AE to those who fail the save. After the AE is applied, the affected creatures will move toward the center of the template.

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text:
@UUID[JournalEntry.xf9bG7UGhYcQFGEn]

Several small vials filled with a noxious green gas hang from the ceiling. A thin tripwire is strung across the path, nearly visible in the dim light. A successful [[/check perception 14]]check reveals the wire before it is triggered.

If the trap is triggered, one or more vials fall and shatter on the ground, releasing a burst of poisonous gas. Each creature within a 15ft cube centered on the impact point must succeed on a [[/save constitution 13]] saving throw or take [[/damage 3d6 poison]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.lq3TRI6ZlED8ABMx]{Poisoned}for 1 hour. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not poisoned.

Bypassing or Disarming the Trap: After spotting the tripwire, players may attempt to carefully step over it. The trap can be disarmed with a successful [[/check dexterity 14]] (Thieves’ Tools) check. On a failure, the trap is triggered as normal. A character without thieves’ tools may attempt to disarm it with disadvantage using improvised tools. The vials located 12ft above the ground, can be carefully removed. Doing so requires a successful [[/check dexterity 14]] (Sleight of Hand) check, possibly using a pole, mage hand, or climbing to reach them. Failure may trigger the trap at the GM’s discretion. The trap may also be intentionally triggered from a safe distance, by throwing an object, firing a projectile, or casting a spell.

GM Notes: When a player approaches the trap area, the game will automatically pause, allowing the GM to prompt the closest player to make a Perception check to spot the trap. If the players successfully disarm the trap, the GM should also disable it using the UI below. If the trap is not disabled, then the first player who enters the trap area will trigger it. The Constitution saving throw, damage roll, damage application, and Poisoned condition are all handled automatically for the token that enters the trap area. Once triggered, the trap disarms itself and will not activate again for other players.
Important: The region before the trap will only trigger the game to pause if a player-controlled token enters it.

Use this @UUID[Macro.0aHzFNGk2IK2GxFc]{Interactive Map Features UI} to enable or disable the poison gas trap.

Flame Tyrant.name: 烈焰暴君
Flame Tyrant.description:
准备好在 Foundry VTT 中开启一场身临其境的冒险吧，深入到一座活火山的中心地带。在这里，置身于地狱烈焰的狂暴之中，您的团队将面对强大的烈焰暴君及其爪牙，接受来自地狱怒火的严峻考验。

这场遭遇发生在火山洞穴的动荡环境中，熔岩和滚烫的岩石在洞穴地面肆意流淌，形成险象环生的地形，为您的冒险之旅增添重重挑战。与强大的烈焰暴君及其手下展开一场惊心动魄的战斗，他们各具独特的能力和战术。此遭遇战会根据您的团队等级动态调整难度，确保为各种能力水平的角色带来令人兴奋的挑战。

本遭遇通过动态指示物呈现的生物提升了遭遇的视觉吸引力和刺激感，带来沉浸式的游戏体验。战胜火焰暴君后，小队将获得一件为冒险者精心准备的暴君所拥有的魔法物品。
Flame Tyrant.caption: 遭遇：烈焰暴君

Death Nova.name: 死亡新星
Death Nova.description: 死亡新星。烈焰元素死亡时会爆发出一团火焰。在其 5 尺范围内的每个生物都必须进行一次敏捷豁免（DC为 11），豁免失败则受到 1d6 点火焰伤害，豁免成功则只受到一半伤害。

Flames Breath.name: 烈焰吐息
Flames Breath.description: 烈焰吐息。烈焰元素可以向 5 尺范围内的生物喷吐火焰。该生物必须进行一次DC 为 11 的敏捷豁免检定，豁免失败则受到 2d6 点火焰伤害，豁免成功则只受到一半伤害。

The Flame Tyrant CR6.name: 烈焰暴君 CR6
The Flame Tyrant CR6.description:
烈焰暴君语录

  1. "我乃烈焰暴君！你们凡世的史册，将以我的荣光烙下永恒印记！"

  2. "烈焰净化、提纯、毁灭。你们自认为强大到能掌控它？让我们来检验一下你们的决心。"

  3. "熄灭我的火焰？愚蠢的凡人。我的火焰永恒不灭，我对其的统治亦是如此。你们要么燃烧，要么屈服！"

  4. "谈判？只有一种谈判：我的意志或你们的灭亡。你们能拿出什么能与烈焰之力相匹敌？"

  5. "我的火焰永恒，我的力量坚不可摧。屈服或燃烧。"

  6. "在我体内奔腾的地狱之火，凡人无法驯服。我是火焰至高无上的明证。"

  7. "啊，蝼蚁竟敢直面烈焰暴君？你们的反抗将成为狱火之力的见证！"

  8. "渴求知识？力量真谛在于掌控，而非空谈理解。若你们追求力量，那就面对我，证明你们的价值。"

Pyro Head - The Infernal Crown.name: 烈焰之首 - 地狱火冠
Pyro Head - The Infernal Crown.description:
奇物，极珍稀（需由战士、术士、法师、魔契师或游荡者同调）

"烈焰藏于其中。凝视着烈焰，凝视着这件古物本质的摇曳，然后获得新生。"

地狱火冠又名烈焰之首，是在一座已熄灭的火山中心锻造而成的圣物。头盔形似被火焰吞噬的骷髅。

余烬凝视。 以一个动作，你可从炼狱颅首发动凝视攻击。三道射线自盔甲眼窝与口部射向 30 尺锥状区域内最近的三名生物，所有目标必须进行一次 DC 15 的敏捷豁免。豁免失败则受到 4d6 点火焰伤害，成功则伤害减半。若有生物因此攻击死亡，你获得等同于该生物所受伤害的临时生命值（不超过该生物生命值上限）。一旦使用两次，此能力在完成长休前无法再次使用。

地狱屏障。 你免疫环境高温伤害，并对所有火焰类攻击或法术具有抗性。

威慑灵光。 你在威吓检定中获得 +5 加值，但在游说检定中承受 -5 减值。

诅咒。 当戴上地狱火冠时，头盔将与使用者熔接在颅骨上无法移除。此时你的头颅将呈现燃烧骷髅形态（火焰无实体伤害，不散发热量与光芒）。此盔在你存活期间永不可卸除。

Pyro Head.name: 烈焰之首
Pyro Head.description:
• 火焰伤害抗性

  • 威吓检定中获得 +5 加值。

  • 游说检定中承受 -5 减值。

Flame Shield.name: 烈焰护盾
Flame Shield.description: 烈焰护盾。以一个附赠动作，烈焰暴君会在自身周围生成一道火焰护盾。在该法术持续期间，任何在 5 尺范围内以近战攻击命中它的生物都会受到 1d8 点火焰伤害。

Molten Resurgence.name: 熔火复苏
Molten Resurgence.description: 熔火复苏（1/长休）。以一个附赠动作，烈焰暴君可以潜入熔岩或岩浆池中，并恢复相当于其当前最大生命值一半的生命值。

Pyroblast.name: 炎爆
Pyroblast.description: 炎爆。以一个动作，烈焰暴君可将 120 尺内其可见的一名生物作为目标。该生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免，否则将受到 2d8 点火焰伤害。若豁免失败则目标陷入燃烧状态，从其每一回合开始时额外受到 1d4 点火焰伤害，直至其以一个动作熄灭火焰为止。

Pyroblast.name: 炎爆
Pyroblast.description: 燃烧来自炎爆，每回合开始时你会额外受到 1d4 点火焰伤害，直到你以一个动作扑灭火焰为止。

Infernal Explosion.name: 炼狱爆轰
Infernal Explosion.description: 炼狱爆轰（充能 5-6）。烈焰暴君向其可见的一点投掷出一个火球。以该点为源点，半径 20 尺的球状区域内的所有生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免。豁免失败则受到 8d6 点火焰伤害，豁免成功则只受到一半伤害。

Inferno Wave.name: 炼狱怒涛
Inferno Wave.description: 炼狱怒涛（充能 5-6）。烈焰暴君可以以一次动作，猛击地面，引发一波波强烈的热浪向外扩散，使地面燃烧起烈焰，持续 1 分钟。在 15 尺半径范围内的所有生物，以及在持续时间内进入该区域的任何生物，都必须进行一次敏捷豁免。豁免失败则只要还位于该区域内就将具有火焰伤害易伤。成功豁免则物不会受其影响。

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: 如果烈焰暴君豁免失败时，可以将其改为豁免成功。

Legendary Actions.name: 传奇动作
Legendary Actions.description:
烈焰暴君拥有 3 传奇动作。用来选择执行下列动作项。它每次只可选择执行一个传奇动作项，且必须在另一生物回合结束时执行。

烈焰暴君拥有 3 传奇动作。

Lair Actions.name: 巢穴动作
Lair Actions.description:
如果传奇生物拥有巢穴动作，它可以利用巢穴中的环境魔力。在先攻轮到 20 时（出现等值时视为后手），它可以使用其中一个巢穴动作选项。当它处于失能状态或无法采取行动时，不能使用巢穴动作。如果被突袭，它不能在战斗的第一回合之前使用巢穴动作。

如果传奇生物拥有巢穴动作，它可以利用巢穴中的环境魔力。

Infernal Glide.name: 狱火闪身
Infernal Glide.description: 狱火闪身。烈焰暴君可以移动至多等于其速度的一半。

Fire Tornado.name: 火焰龙卷
Fire Tornado.description: 火焰龙卷。火焰暴君选择其可见的一点，以该点为源点，创造出一个半径 10 尺、高 30 尺的柱状火旋风。烈火席卷地面，熔化或烧焦土地，空气中弥漫着灰烬和火星。柱状区域内将被视为困难地形，持续 1 分钟。

Fire Wall.name: 火墙
Fire Wall.description: 火墙。烈焰暴君创造出一面长 20 尺、高 10 尺、厚 5 尺的直线型火墙。火墙出现时，所有位于火墙所占据的区域内的生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免。豁免失败，受到 3d8 点火焰伤害。豁免成功，则只受一半伤害。生物在回合内首次进入此墙或在该墙内开始回合时，都会受到伤害。

Pyroblast Retaliation.name: 炎爆报偿
Pyroblast Retaliation.description: 炎爆报偿。烈焰暴君可以对其可见的生物施展炎爆报偿。

余烬凝视。 以一个动作，你可从炼狱颅首发动凝视攻击。三道射线自盔甲眼窝与口部射向 30 尺锥状区域内最近的三名生物，所有目标必须进行一次 DC 17 的敏捷豁免。豁免失败则受到 6d6 点火焰伤害，成功则伤害减半。若有生物因此攻击死亡，你获得等同于该生物所受伤害的临时生命值（不超过该生物生命值上限）。一旦使用两次，此能力在完成长休前无法再次使用。

烈焰行走。你获得在熔岩或其他熔融物质表面行走的能力，就如同在坚实的地面上行走一般。你身后不会留下火焰痕迹，也不会高温受到伤害。

地狱屏障。 你免疫环境高温伤害，并对所有火焰类攻击或法术具有抗性。

威慑灵光。 你在威吓检定中获得 +5 加值，但在游说检定中承受 -5 减值。

Mechanics.name: 机制
Mechanics.text:
1. 使用该物品需进行装备与同调。

  2. 在被玩家或NPC装备前，可修改此物品的名称。魔法物品已装备后不建议进行重命名操作。

  3. 地狱屏障只有在物品同调后才能生效。

  4. 作为玩家使用余烬凝视的方法：

    • 使用物品并放置锥状测量模板。

    • 在模板内选定最多 3 名生物（重要的是要将目标选定在生物上，否则动画不会播放）。

    • 进行伤害掷骰（此时动画应播放）。

    • GM 应为生物掷敏捷豁免，并相应地造成伤害

  5. 作为 GM 使用余烬凝视的方法：

    • 使用物品并放置锥状测量模板。

    • 在模板内选择最多 3 名生物。

    • 为生物掷敏捷豁免。

    • 进行伤害掷骰（此时动画应播放）。

    • 应用相应的伤害。

LORE.name: 逸闻
LORE.text:
相传，有一位法师对火焰怀有深厚的痴迷，并坚信其中蕴藏着终极力量。为此，他踏上前往一座已熄灭火山深处的旅程。在火山内部，他发现了一个特殊的空间，在那里物质世界与火元素位面之间的界限极为薄弱，从而使其能够掌握最为纯粹的火焰魔法。随着时间推移，他对力量的追求逐渐演变为对绝对权力的执念。通过大量使用珍稀材料与古老咒语进行实验，他最终锻造出“地狱火冠”，而这一过程也意外唤醒了沉睡的火山。

随后，他自封为“烈焰暴君”，并对周边地区展开毁灭性的征服行动。在他的攻势下，村庄与城镇接连沦陷，被烈焰吞噬。幸存者因目睹火焰肆虐一切而惊恐万分，纷纷逃往邻近王国，并广泛传播一种说法：此次火山喷发并非自然现象，而是由一个被称为“火头怪”的存在所引发。

LAIR.name: 巢穴
LAIR.text: 该遭遇发生于一座活跃火山的中心区域。空气中弥漫着熔岩与炽热岩石所散发出的高温，令人感到窒息；洞穴底部不断被流动的熔岩侵蚀，形成复杂的地貌结构。

ADVENTURE HOOKS.name: 冒险引子
ADVENTURE HOOKS.text:
迷失的探险队。冒险者们在火山附近发现了一支此前失踪探险队的遗骸。在这些残骸中，有一本详细记录他们对抗烈焰暴君过程的日记。

神秘的火焰。全国各地的城镇和村庄都出现了神秘的火焰爆发，所到之处一片狼藉。这些火焰爆发的模式让冒险者们怀疑有人正在以前所未有的规模使用火焰魔法。

燃烧瘟疫。一个地处偏远的村庄爆发了一种无法解释的瘟疫，感染者会突然自燃，情况异常诡异。

火焰邪教的威胁。一个以崇拜火焰为核心的邪教组织正逐步壮大其势力与影响力，企图在全球范围内引发一场毁灭性的火焰灾难。

BOSS.name: BOSS
BOSS.text:
烈焰暴君

护甲等级： 14（无甲）

生命值： 119（14d8 + 56）

速度： 30 尺

属性值：

  • 力量： 10（+0）
  • 敏捷： 18（+4）
  • 体质： 16（+3）
  • 智力： 14（+2）
  • 感知： 12（+1）
  • 魅力： 18（+4）

语言： 深渊语，通用语，火族语

伤害抗性： 火焰

伤害易伤： 寒冷

状态免疫： 魅惑，恐慌

挑战等级： 8（3,900 XP）

外观： 火焰暴君站立时超过 8 尺高，颅骨状头颅中燃烧着熔金般的眼瞳，身披深红法袍，肩后垂着干涸血迹色的飘动斗篷。

动作

  1. 炎爆。以一个动作，烈焰暴君可将 120 尺内其可见的一名生物作为目标。该生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免，否则将受到 2d8 点火焰伤害。若豁免失败则目标陷入燃烧状态，从其每一回合开始时额外受到 1d4 点火焰伤害，直至其以一个动作熄灭火焰为止。

  2. 炼狱爆轰（充能 5-6）。烈焰暴君向其可见的一点投掷出一个火球。以该点为源点，半径 20 尺的球状区域内的所有生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免。豁免失败则受到 8d6 点火焰伤害，豁免成功则只受到一半伤害。

  3. 炼狱怒涛（充能 5-6）。烈焰暴君可以以一次动作，猛击地面，引发一波波强烈的热浪向外扩散，使地面燃烧起烈焰，持续 1 分钟。在 15 尺半径范围内的所有生物，以及在持续时间内进入该区域的任何生物，都必须进行一次敏捷豁免。豁免失败则只要还位于该区域内就将具有火焰伤害易伤。成功豁免则物不会受其影响。

  4. 烈焰护盾。以一个附赠动作，烈焰暴君会在自身周围生成一道火焰护盾。在该法术持续期间，任何在 5 尺范围内以近战攻击命中它的生物都会受到 1d8 点火焰伤害。

  5. 熔火复苏（1/长休）。以一个附赠动作，烈焰暴君可以潜入熔岩或岩浆池中，并恢复相当于其当前最大生命值一半的生命值。

传奇动作

烈焰暴君拥有 3 传奇动作。用来选择执行下列动作项。它每次只可选择执行一个传奇动作项，且必须在另一生物回合结束时执行。

  1. 狱火闪身。烈焰暴君可以移动至多等于其速度的一半。

  2. 炎爆报偿。烈焰暴君可以对其可见的生物施展炎爆报偿。

传奇抗性

每日 1 次，豁免失败时可改为成功。

巢穴动作

在先攻值 20 时（同值后手）发动巢穴效果，不可连续两轮使用相同效果：

  1. 火墙。烈焰暴君创造出一面长 20 尺、高 10 尺、厚 5 尺的直线型火墙。火墙出现时，所有位于火墙所占据的区域内的生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免。豁免失败，受到 3d8 点火焰伤害。豁免成功，则只受一半伤害。生物在回合内首次进入此墙或在该墙内开始回合时，都会受到伤害。

  2. 火焰龙卷。火焰暴君选择其可见的一点，以该点为源点，创造出一个半径 10 尺、高 30 尺的柱状火旋风。烈火席卷地面，熔化或烧焦土地，空气中弥漫着灰烬和火星。柱状区域内将被视为困难地形，持续 1 分钟。

战术

  1. 使用烈焰护盾配合狱火闪身防止近身，保持与玩家距离
  2. 对受伤敌人发动头盔能力“余烬凝视”
  3. 被近身时发动炼狱怒涛
  4. 用炎爆集火火焰易伤目标
  5. 朝玩家密集区施放炼狱爆轰
  6. 生命值减半时启动熔火复苏

烈焰暴君语录

  1. "我乃烈焰暴君！你们凡世的史册，将以我的荣光烙下永恒印记！"

  2. "烈焰净化、提纯、毁灭。你们自认为强大到能掌控它？让我们来检验一下你们的决心。"

  3. "熄灭我的火焰？愚蠢的凡人。我的火焰永恒不灭，我对其的统治亦是如此。你们要么燃烧，要么屈服！"

  4. "谈判？只有一种谈判：我的意志或你们的灭亡。你们能拿出什么能与烈焰之力相匹敌？"

  5. "我的火焰永恒，我的力量坚不可摧。屈服或燃烧。"

  6. "在我体内奔腾的地狱之火，凡人无法驯服。我是火焰至高无上的明证。"

  7. "啊，蝼蚁竟敢直面烈焰暴君？你们的反抗将成为狱火之力的见证！"

  8. "渴求知识？力量真谛在于掌控，而非空谈理解。若你们追求力量，那就面对我，证明你们的价值。"

MINIONS.name: 奴仆
MINIONS.text:
火焰暴君驱使数名元素仆从，这些生物将疯狂护卫主人并焚灭一切入侵者。

火焰元素

护甲等级： 12（天生护甲）

生命值： 7（2d6）

速度： 飞行 30 尺

属性值：

  • 力量： 7（-2）
  • 敏捷： 14（+2）
  • 体质： 10（+0）
  • 智力： 7（-2）
  • 感知： 10（+0）
  • 魅力： 10（+0）

感官： 黑暗视觉 60 尺

语言： 火族语

伤害免疫： 火焰

伤害易伤： 寒冷

状态免疫： 中毒

挑战等级： 1/2（100 XP）

外观： 火焰元素是由纯粹烈焰构成的生物，头部形似燃烧的火把，肢体与双翼如扭动的火舌。受原始本能驱使游荡于沙漠与火山地带，常被更强大的存在束缚驱使。

动作

  1. 烈焰吐息。烈焰元素可以向 5 尺范围内的生物喷吐火焰。该生物必须进行一次 DC 为 11 的敏捷豁免检定，豁免失败则受到 2d6 点火焰伤害，豁免成功则只受到一半伤害。

  2. 死亡新星。烈焰元素死亡时会爆发出一团火焰。在其 5 尺范围内的每个生物都必须进行一次敏捷豁免（DC 为 11），豁免失败则受到 1d6 点火焰伤害，豁免成功则只受到一半伤害。

MECHANICS.name: 机制
MECHANICS.text:
烈焰暴君

  1. 可安全重命名该 NPC（例：从名称中移除 CR 等级）

  2. CR8 版本装备烈焰之首 - 地狱火冠（传奇）

  3. CR6 版本装备烈焰之首 - 地狱火冠（珍稀）

  4. 炼狱怒涛： GM 需手动管理“火焰易伤”主动效应（AE）

    • 当指示物进入/离开范围模板时添加/移除小样

  5. 炎爆： GM 需手动管理目标令牌的「点燃」动态效果（AE）

  6. 烈焰护盾双模式：

    • 含 AE 伤害 - 为施法者添加 AE，触发动画并结算伤害
    • 无动画伤害 - 仅结算伤害不触发动画

烈焰元素

  1. 死亡新星： 需在元素死亡后发动

  2. 战败视觉更新： 元素被击败后使用，将动画指示物替换为静态图像

  • 炎爆术“燃烧”效应持续伤害

豁免 DC与属性字段为可选项，留空时选定指示物必受全额伤害

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: 难度调整
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
本次遭遇战的战斗难度可动态调整，其具体强度取决于以下因素：玩家角色等级、魔法物品储备、队伍规模、战场环境、敌人数量以及每个敌人的挑战等级。
实战中可通过每回合增援 CR 1/2 仆从动态调节难度

针对 CR 6 的 BOSS 和四个 CR 1/2 的仆从的遭遇难度示例评估：

  • 对于 4 名等级为 3 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为致命。

  • 对于 4 名等级为 4 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为高。

  • 对于 4 名等级为 5 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为中等。

  • 对于 4 名等级为 6 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为低。

针对 CR 8 的 BOSS 和四个 CR 1/2 的仆从的遭遇难度示例评估：

  • 对于 4 名等级为 6 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为致命。

  • 对于 4 名等级为 8 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为高。

  • 对于 4 名等级为 10 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为中。

Ogre Hideout.name: 食人魔藏身处
Ogre Hideout.description: 在崎岖的峡谷中，一群冒险者在一处巨大的岩石遮蔽处寻找庇护，却意外发现这里是两个可怕的食人魔兄弟——格罗姆和格拉克的巢穴。这场充满活力的遭遇战中，有动态指示物、技能和魔法物品，营造出一种身临其境且视觉效果引人入胜的体验。格罗姆挥舞着他的魔法大棒“头槌”，而格拉克则用他的带刃皮鞭掌控战场。遮蔽处狭窄的空间加大了挑战难度，食人魔兄弟协同作战，试图压倒冒险者队伍。一旦食人魔被击败，冒险者们就能获得他们的魔法物品，每件物品都有独特的攻击动画和艺术设计。这次遭遇战还附带一份详尽的日志，提供背景故事、战术见解以及所有必要的信息，以确保这是一次刺激且互动性强的冒险。
Ogre Hideout.caption: 食人魔藏身处遭遇

Ogre Chieftain: Grom CR2.name: 食人魔头目：格罗姆 CR2
Ogre Chieftain: Grom CR2.description:
格罗姆语录

  1. “格罗姆砸得最狠！谁敢不服吃俺一棒！"

  2. “想和格罗姆比脑瓜？哈！俺比石头聪明两倍，力气大双倍！"

  3. "格罗姆有大棒槌，大拳头，还有大胃口。你当晚餐味道不错？"

  4. “要啥花里胡哨的法术？俺有棒槌和钢牙！"

  5. "你们别想活着离开这！"

  6. “格罗姆最烦串门的！来一个砸碎一个，压扁一个，当点心吃一个！"

  7. “格拉克抄家伙！让这些小不点知道谁才是老大！"

Hide Armor.name: 兽皮甲
Hide Armor.description: 一种由厚毛皮制作的粗糙护甲。常见使用人群包括：野蛮人部落、邪恶类人生物以及其它缺少资源制作更好护甲的人。

Ogre Brutality.name: 食人魔凶蛮
Ogre Brutality.description: 食人魔凶蛮。 当食人魔的近战攻击命中目标时，可额外掷骰一枚该攻击的伤害骰。

Punch.name: 拳击
Punch.description: 拳击。近战武器攻击：命中 +6，触及 5 尺，单一目标。命中：目标受到 [[/roll 1d4 + 4]] 钝击伤害。

Throw Rock.name: 投石
Throw Rock.description: 投石。远程攻击：命中 +6，射程 30/120 尺，单一目标。命中：目标受到 [[/roll 1d6 + 4]] 钝击伤害。

Ogre’s Headbutt.name: 食人魔头槌
Ogre’s Headbutt.description:
武器（巨棒），珍稀（需同调）

“传说食人魔酋长伊格·碎骨者拥有钢铁头骨，即便身首异处后，族人仍将其颅骨固定于铁木棒端，包钢头骨铸就了这把致命凶器，让这位暴君死后仍能用他的钢铁脑袋碰碎敌人的骨头脑袋。”

这件武器显现为金属环加固的重木棒，顶端镶嵌着呈咆哮状的食人魔颅骨，骨缝间隐约可见暗红血垢。

完成同调后，持有者获得以下增益：

  • 使用该魔法武器进行攻击检定与伤害掷骰时获得 +1 加值。

  • 对命中的目标造成额外 1d8 钝击伤害

食人魔猛击。当持用者体型至少为大型，攻击附加倒地效果。若目标体型不超过大型且造成的伤害不低于伤害骰最值的一半，则目标陷入倒地状态。

Ogre Whipmaster: Grak CR2.name: 食人魔鞭笞大师：格拉克 CR2
Ogre Whipmaster: Grak CR2.description:
格拉克语录

  1. “搞啥计划破事？砸东西才够劲！"

  2. “食人魔的力气大过天，赶紧认输省得被砸扁！"

  3. “咱就爱闹腾！安静准没好事！食人魔嗓门震天响！"

  4. “先砸再说，问话免谈！"

  5. “肚皮咕咕叫，你们闻着真香！"

  6. “鬼鬼祟祟的小东西！敢骗食人魔？找死！"

Throw Rock.name: 投石
Throw Rock.description: 投石。远程攻击：命中 +6，射程 30/120 尺，单一目标。命中：目标受到 [[/roll 1d6 + 4]] 钝击伤害。

Bladed Whip.name: 带刃长鞭
Bladed Whip.description:
武器（鞭），非普通（需同调）

“这根鞭子是金子做的！每一道伤疤都价值连城。”

这柄鞭子的柄把用皮革包裹，两端闪烁这金属光芒。鞭子的尖头是一片由发光的魔法金属制成的刀刃。

长鞭绊摔。当你攻击命中一名生物时，你可以尝试绊摔。目标必须通过一次DC 13 的力量豁免检定，否则陷入倒地状态。

开膛鞭击。使用该鞭造成重击时，你可以额外造成 [[/roll 1d4]] 挥砍伤害。

Bladed Whip (Rare) v3.name: Bladed Whip (Rare) v3
Bladed Whip (Rare) v3.description:
Weapon (whip), rare (requires attunement)

"This whip is golden! Each scar is priceless."

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

The whip’s handle is wrapped in leather with shining metallic ends. At the tip of the whip is a blade made from the same glowing metal.

Whip Trip. When you hit a creature with this whip, you can attempt to trip it. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw DC 15 or fall prone.

Eviscerating Strike. When you score a critical hit with this whip, you deal an additional [[/roll 2d4]] slashing damage.

Bladed Whip (Uncommon) v3.name: Bladed Whip (Uncommon) v3
Bladed Whip (Uncommon) v3.description:
Weapon (whip), uncommon (requires attunement)

"This whip is golden! Each scar is priceless."

The whip’s handle is wrapped in leather with shining metallic ends. At the tip of the whip is a blade made from the same glowing metal.

Whip Trip. When you hit a creature with this whip, you can attempt to trip it. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw DC 13 or fall prone.

Eviscerating Strike. When you score a critical hit with this whip, you deal an additional [[/roll 1d4]] slashing damage.

Bladed Whip (Very Rare) v3.name: Bladed Whip (Very Rare) v3
Bladed Whip (Very Rare) v3.description:
Weapon (whip), very rare (requires attunement)

"This whip is golden! Each scar is priceless."

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

The whip’s handle is wrapped in leather with shining metallic ends. At the tip of the whip is a blade made from the same glowing metal.

Whip Trip. When you hit a creature with this whip, you can attempt to trip it. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw DC 17 or fall prone.

Eviscerating Strike. When you score a critical hit with this whip, you deal an additional [[/roll 4d4]] slashing damage.

Ogre’s Headbutt v3.name: Ogre’s Headbutt v3
Ogre’s Headbutt v3.description:
Weapon (greatclub), rare (requires attunement)

"It was said that Yig Bonegnaw had an iron skull so when he lost his head, they put his skull on a trunk of ironwood and bound it in steel so his mighty forehead will crush the bones of his enemies even in death."

This weapon appears as the skull of an ogre atop a heavy wooden club bound in metal rings.

When you are attuned to this greatclub, you gain the following benefits:

  • +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

  • Extra 1d8 bludgeoning damage to any creature it hits.

Ogre's Slam. When you wield the Ogre's Headbutt and your size is Large, your attacks gain the ability to knock down opponents. If your attack hits and deals half or more damage to a creature that is Large in size or smaller, that creature is knocked prone.

LOCATION.name: 地点
LOCATION.text: 两个食人魔兄弟的藏身之处是一个巨大的岩石悬垂，位于一个崎岖峡谷的深处。

ADVENTURE HOOK.name: 冒险引子
ADVENTURE HOOK.text:
失踪的商队。 一支贵重商队在穿越峡谷时失踪。商人行会承诺为重金酬谢能找回货物并营救幸存者的人。

肆虐的食人魔。 食人魔一直在附近村庄肆虐——偷窃牲畜、毁坏财产、制造混乱。村民为求安宁向冒险者求助，承诺消灭食人魔威胁者将获得报酬。

风暴避难所。 冒险者在穿越崎岖峡谷时遭遇了暴风雨，在一处巨大岩檐下躲避，却无意间闯入了两头食人魔占据的隐秘巢穴。

  2. 拳击和投石：这些能力可进行配置，其伤害值可根据需要进行调整。

  • 对于 4 名等级为 3 级且不考虑魔法物品的玩家角色，这场遭遇战预计难度为中等。

TACTICS.name: 战术
TACTICS.text: 格罗姆将会挥舞他的巨棒冲锋、猛击敌人，而格拉克则会使用他的长鞭骚扰并扰乱那些较弱的敌人。

LORE.name: 逸闻
LORE.text: 两个食人魔兄弟，格罗姆和格拉克，在一场暴风雨中，他们在峡谷里偶然发现了一个巨大的岩石遮蔽处。如今，这个隐蔽的藏身处成了他们袭击和恐吓周边地区的窝点。格罗姆挥舞着一根巨棒，此巨棒是用一位传奇食人魔战士的头骨打造而成，这位战士死后，其坚硬的头颅被绑在铁木棍棒的顶端，并用钢条固定。格拉克则使用从他们上次杀掉的冒险者那里夺来的鞭子。

INTRO.name: 简介
INTRO.text:
冒险者从远处听到兄弟俩陷入激烈争吵。他们意识到争论焦点是某件武器。

格罗姆（用拳捶打胸膛）："大棒槌就该归俺！俺更老更大！所以老爹才传它，就像老老爹传给他那样！你现在有鞭子了，少叽歪！"

格拉克（回呛）："破鞭子哪有棒槌好！大棒槌能砸扁东西，能敲碎骨头！鞭子只能抽人嗷嗷叫！"

格罗姆（得意）："不过鞭子吓唬人类挺好使。鞭子一抽他们就鬼哭狼嚎。准是你不会用。"

格拉克（暴躁）："咱会用鞭！咱就想要真家伙，像大棒槌那种。咱想听骨头碎，不想光听人嚎！"

格罗姆（后仰身子，厌烦挥手）："你连棒槌名儿都不知道，蠢蛋小食人魔！族规说最年长的拿祖传大棒槌——俺最老！俺当头儿，头儿说棒槌归俺！有俺在部落才强！敢顶嘴就揍扁你，像老太婆揍你这小崽子时那样！"

格拉克（退后几步，咧嘴狡笑嘟囔）："咱越长越壮实，你越老越不中用，格罗姆。大棒槌迟早归咱... 今天算了，改天吧。到时候咱就用这祖传硬头棒槌揍扁你。"

Volcathar Ascension.name: 伏尔卡萨崛起
Volcathar Ascension.description:
流言正在贸易村落中蔓延，恐惧已深深扎根。人们紧闭门户，只结伴出行——那些胆敢独自外出的人再无音讯。关于夜幕降临时的黑影和一种莫名的恐怖的传言，让村民们心惊胆战。朋友、亲人，甚至路过的旅人，都神秘地消失得无影无踪，随着失踪事件的持续，整个村落笼罩在一片恐慌之中。

隐匿于附近山脉的狂热教派正是失踪案的元凶。在龙吼祭司寇梵领导下，该教派崇拜名为“焚世者伏尔卡萨”的青年红龙。信徒们相信通过崇拜与献祭能将巨龙束缚于其意志之下。但他们不知道，伏尔卡萨只是佯装被控制——他完全清楚信徒的意图。因知晓仪式能助其蜕变为成年巨龙，他默许了教派的存在。一伙冒险者受雇调查失踪事件。他们能否穿越险恶的地形，营救俘虏，并在伏尔卡萨的力量变得不可阻挡之前阻止邪教？

时间在流逝，他们每前进一步，就离那远超想象的巨大危险更近一步。

邪教头目的AC会依据角色卡上的“武僧无甲防御”设定自动计算得出。若邪教头目身着护甲，GM则需手动调整其防御等级。

邪教徒挥拳攻击。

Martial Arts.description:
武艺没有任何自动化。该特性带来的所有增益已直接写入“徒手打击”。

蒙面头目使用徒手打击进行攻击时，可以用敏捷代替力量进行攻击检定和伤害掷骰。并可选择用 1d6 骰代替原本的伤害骰。此外，蒙面邪教徒可以用附赠动作发动一次徒手打击。

Volcathar the Flameborn CR 10.description:
焚世者伏尔卡萨语录

仪式遭遇阶段：

  1. "好好铭记此刻的绝望吧，待吾等再次相遇时，尔等面对的将是百倍炽烈的焚天之焰！"

  2. "这就开始畏惧灼热了？真正的炼狱尚未降临！"

  3. "在真正的战斗开始前，吾特许尔等先体验慢火炙烤的乐趣。"

身处巢穴中：

  1. "欢迎来到炼狱——不知诸位是否感受到吾之巢穴的热情款待？"
  2. "尔等脚下的熔岩正在翻涌，那会是你们最后的安息之地。"
  3. "在终结你们可悲的生命之前，吾会让尔等深刻领会何为极致的痛苦。"
  4. "血肉焦香真是令人愉悦——这气息值得细细品味。"

仆从溃败时：

  1. "这些蝼蚁活着时是累赘，死时也不过是助燃的柴薪！"

重伤/防御状态：

  1. "妄以为胜券在握？尔等的得势只不过是一时的虚妄。"

终局宣言：

  1. "百年来烈焰皆臣服于我，纵使焚尽世界，吾亦永为主宰！"
  2. "诸神尚在吾之威压下战栗，区区凡躯也敢僭越？"
  3. "英雄？可笑！尔等的勇气会化作飞灰，野心将成余烬！"

嘲弄讥讽：

  1. “这便是凡人的全力？吾曾烤炙的岩蜥都比尔等顽强！”
  2. “有趣的顽抗...此刻便让尔等知晓，何谓龙怒天威！”

败退时：

  1. "暂且…算你们略胜一筹…"

TACTICS.name: 战术
TACTICS.text:
伏尔卡萨：

  • 通过火焰吐息与队伍保持战术距离，优先进行远程压制。仅在建立绝对优势或战场地形有利时发动近战突袭

龙喉祭司寇梵：

  • 使用龙语敕令强化邪教徒的狂热战斗状态
  • 当战局需要武力威慑时，会主动切入战场进行压制

蒙面信徒：

  • 呈现无理智狂热作战状态，绝不撤退，至死方休

ADVENTURE HOOKS.name: 冒险引子
ADVENTURE HOOKS.text: 一个贸易村报告说，有几位居民在神秘的情况下失踪了。冒险者们受雇去调查这些失踪事件。据一名最近逃脱的人质称，他在被押往火山所在的山里途中成功逃走，罪魁祸首是一群戴着面具的邪教徒。他描述这些邪教徒戴着面具，还能从手中生出火焰。冒险者们必须追查这伙邪教徒，揭露他们的阴谋，并在为时已晚之前解救所有人质。

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: 难度调整
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
本次遭遇战的战斗难度可动态调整，其具体强度取决于以下因素：玩家角色等级、魔法物品储备、队伍规模、战场环境、敌人数量以及每个敌人的挑战等级。

本冒险模组默认针对 4 名 9-10 级的玩家角色设计，但亦可调整为其他等级。

最简易的难度调节方式是修改怪物的生命值、护甲值或伤害值。

动画效果（可选）

青年红龙

  • 使红龙飞行时，需使用飞行能力。

  • @UUID[Macro.18OFk8shtNUk8Qm1]{指示物伤害}。快速对选定目标施加伤害的实用工具。DC与能力字段为选填项，若留空则默认目标承受全额伤害。此宏适用于所有地图场景。

ADVENTURE SUMMARY.name: ADVENTURE SUMMARY
ADVENTURE SUMMARY.text:
Rumors are spreading through the trading village, where fear has taken root. People are barring their doors and traveling only in groups, for those who venture out alone never return. Whispers of shadows in the night and an unnamed terror have seized the hearts of the villagers. Friends, family, and even passing travelers have mysteriously vanished without a trace, leaving the community gripped by dread as the disappearances continue.

A fanatical cult, hidden in the nearby mountains, is to blame for the disappearances. Led by Father Korvan, the cult worships a young red dragon named Volcathar the Flameborn. They believe that through worship and sacrificial offerings, they can bind the dragon to their will. Unknown to them, Volcathar only pretends to be controlled, fully aware of the cultists intentions. Knowing that the ritual will transform him into an adult dragon, he tolerates the cult’s presence.

The Vow of the Burning Flesh

The cult’s strictest commandment is the Vow of the Burning Flesh, an oath that forbids the use of weapons. Every initiate, with the help of their fellow cultists, must capture and offer a victim as part of their initiation. The cultists believe that true power comes from within and that weapons are for the weak, for only those who rely on their own strength are deemed worthy of channeling Volcathar’s flames. They aim to reflect the might of the dragon, who needs no mortal weapons to instill terror. At the heart of their combat style and ritual practice are the Bracers of Ignition, magical items crafted from Volcathar's scales. These bracers are gifted to each cultist after they take the Vow of the Burning Flesh. They see the flames that erupt from their bracers as a sign that the dragon’s magic flows through them.

SYNOPSIS.name: 剧情简介
SYNOPSIS.text:
荒原遭遇

朝山脉行进途中，冒险者遭遇邪教徒驱赶人质前往藏身处的队伍。经过武力或交涉后，队伍从邪教徒处获取关键情报：获悉邪教藏匿的巢穴据点，以及正在举行远古仪式的“齿颚崖”。

此刻队伍面临抉择——直捣邪教据点解救更多人质，或急赴齿颚崖中断即将完成的远古仪式。

齿颚崖

如果冒险者们决定前往齿颚崖，他们将面临以下两种情境之一。

  1. 情景一：仪式中断

    成功破坏仪式将使伏尔卡萨维持青年龙形态。受仪式反噬的巨龙会短暂交战数回合后撤回巢穴，同时命令邪教徒围剿冒险者。龙喉祭司寇梵仍妄想能控制巨龙，可能会在绝望中逃往巢穴。

    当冒险者们追击至巢穴时，将目睹这般景象：伏尔卡萨正撕咬着最后一名人质泄愤，龙喉祭司寇梵则跪在熔岩池边瑟瑟发抖。发现入侵者的红龙瞳孔骤然收缩，甩尾将龙喉祭司寇梵抽向冒险者，熔岩飞溅中传来震耳欲聋的咆哮：“蝼蚁，用你们的血平息吾之怒火！”
    此刻巨龙因仪式失败陷入虚弱状态，若能用战术诱使其离开岩浆区域，便有机会终结这头青年红龙。

  2. 情景二：仪式完成

    伏尔卡萨将成功蜕变为成年巨龙，但因急速转化陷入虚弱，退守巢穴并驱使邪教徒阻击冒险者。龙喉祭司寇梵亦会伺机逃向巨龙巢穴。

    • 分支 1：寇梵逃脱

      若寇梵脱逃成功，冒险者可尾随其进入龙巢。

      冒险者将偷听到寇梵与巨龙的短暂对峙。彻底陷入癫狂的寇梵仍坚信自己能操控巨龙，而伏尔卡萨戏谑地看着蝼蚁的表演，用龙焰将邪教首领烧成灰烬。

      若重创伏尔卡萨，他将遁入熔岩并发誓复仇，完全蜕变需[[/roll 1d6 + 6]]个月休眠。触动龙巢宝藏将引发洞穴坍塌，冒险者仅有数分钟逃生时间。

    • 分支 2：寇梵伏诛

      若寇梵被截杀于逃亡途中。

      当冒险者们抵达龙巢时，巨龙将保持隐匿状态，直至他们发现其宝藏。一旦宝藏暴露，伏卡萨尔会选择与冒险者交战或尝试谈判。若他选择战斗，其属性与先前阶段相同，但因仪式影响体型有所增大。尽管如此，他仍需[[/roll 1d6 + 6]]个月的沉眠来完成最终蜕变。

      若战斗局势恶化且伏卡萨尔身负重伤，他将撤退至熔岩中，发誓将永恒追杀队伍。若玩家试图窃取宝藏，洞窟会剧烈震颤并引发熔岩上涨，他们仅有数分钟时间在龙巢彻底坍塌前逃离。

巨龙巢穴

如果冒险者们直接前往巢穴。

当冒险者们进入龙巢时，会发现巢穴近乎空荡，仅有一名人质被关押。随着深入探索，他们将在“巨廊”中发现壁画，描绘了巨龙通过献祭仪式达成成年期的计划。此时，伏尔卡萨会以成年形态从仪式地点返回巢穴，但仍因仪式消耗处于虚弱状态。它将保留与青年形态完全相同的能力和属性值，并需要[[/roll 1d6 + 6]]个月 的沉眠来完成最终蜕变。

巨龙最初会与冒险者们进行数回合交战，但因已达成目的，转而开始谈判。它提出一项交易：若玩家带来试图操控它的邪教徒及其头目寇梵的首级，它将不再袭击邻近村落并长期蛰伏。就在伏尔卡萨提出条件时，寇梵与其邪教徒众抵达龙巢。巨龙随即宣告：

伏尔卡萨："背叛者如期而至。以吾之名惩戒他们，你们的壮举必将得报。"

WASTELAND ENCOUNTER.name: WASTELAND ENCOUNTER
WASTELAND ENCOUNTER.text:
Wasteland Encounter

Map Notes

  1. Entrance

  2. Cultists

Intro

In the dark volcanic wasteland, the party encounters 4 cultists escorting 2 prisoners. The cultists, fanatical and aggressive, immediately attack, shouting:

Cultist: “You’ll be fuel for the ritual!”

Cultist: “Burn in the name of the Flameborn!”

If any cultist is still alive

The party can use [[/check persuasion 14]] check to extract information. The surviving cultist responds cryptically, his gaze fixed on a distant glowing red light. He says:

Cultist: “Look, the fangs of the world are awakening. His true power is nearly here! Father Korvan will bind the god to his will, and we will be reborn as fire lords!”

Cultist (pointing in another direction): “The lair where the god will be resting.”

Cultist (gasps with his last breath): “More lost in chains, both in the god's lair and where the flames claim their prize.”

If no cultists are alive

If the adventurers search the bodies and succeed on a [[/check investigation 12]] check, they find a series of cryptic drawings and notes:

Drawing: Shows jagged cliffs beneath a red sky, with the caption: "Where the flames rise, so does he."

Note: Refers to the lair: "Return to the nest before the god is truly born. The lost in chains must be ready for the final sacrifice."

The prisoners might mention overhearing conversations among the cultists about "awakening the flame that will devour the skies." The party might notice a strange red glow pulsing on the distant horizon.

INTRODUCTION.name: INTRODUCTION
INTRODUCTION.text: Volcathar Ascension is a Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition one-shot adventure designed for characters of levels 9-10. It is intended to be completed in 4-6 hours.

TOOTHMAW CLIFFS.name: TOOTHMAW CLIFFS
TOOTHMAW CLIFFS.text:
Toothmaw Cliffs

Map Notes

  1. Entrance

  2. Fire Vortex

  3. Father Korvan

Intro

In the center of the map is a red fire vortex, spinning with intense heat. Anyone within 25ft of the center of the vortex must make a [[/save constitution 14]] saving throw or take [[/damage 2d6 fire]] damage at the start of their turn. Surrounding the vortex are sharp, rocky spires that rise up to 20ft in height, resembling the fangs of some enormous creature. Players can climb or descend these spires, but if they want to jump, they need to succeed on a [[/check acrobatics 12]] check.

The party arrives just in time to witness a dark ritual in progress. Father Korvan and five cultists are preparing to throw prisoners into the vortex to fuel the ritual. Five other cultists stand guard. The young red dragon Volcathar circles in the center of the vortex, surrounded by flames, waiting for his transformation into an adult dragon to be completed.

@Embed[JournalEntry.nPkxCxmnHCKOOHMx.JournalEntryPage.k9j3yaAqiPl25ueQ caption=false cite=false]

Tactical Information

Every round, a cultist throws a prisoner into the vortex.The GM may choose to have Volcathar unleash his fire breath at this moment.

If 3 prisoners are sacrificed, the ritual will be complete, and Volcathar will transform into an adult dragon.

@Embed[JournalEntry.VYXd5t0ZZL2MRrJL.JournalEntryPage.7VeEft3zoSzG1yG1 caption=false cite=false]

Once transformed, the adult dragon will fight for 1-2 rounds but weakened by the transformation, he retreats to his lair.

The party can attempt to stop the ritual by attacking, imobilizing or killing the cultists or the prisoners.

If the ritual fails, Volcathar will join the fight for 2 rounds before retreating to his lair weakened by the incomplete ritual.

GM Notes

Depending on the party's power level, the GM can adjust the timing of the sacrifices to 2 or 3 rounds between each prisoner being thrown into the vortex to maintain an appropriate level of challenge.

Volcathar canot engage the party until the ritual either succeeds or is disrupted.

The cultists are fanatically focused on their task of throwing prisoners into the vortex, and only if directly threatened will they stop their actions to defend themselves.

After the ritual is complete or intrerrupted, Korvan will fight but eventually will try to flee to the lair beleaving that the dragon is under his control.

Flavor Dialogue

Father Korvan (in the middle of the ritual): "Witness the flames that will birth a god!"

Father Korvan (in the middle of the ritual): "Volcathar’s ascension is upon us! No one can stop the Flameborn!"

Father Korvan (in the middle of the ritual): "The fire consumes, the dragon awakens!"

Father Korvan (as the dragon retreats): "Fools! You see? Volcathar obeys my will! The Flameborn is mine to command, his power bound to me by the ritual."

Father Korvan (as the dragon retreats): "You thought to disrupt the ascension, but you’ve only delayed the inevitable!"

Cultists: "Your deaths will fuel our master's rise!"

Cultists: "The Flameborn shall devour the skies!"

Cultists: "Another soul to stoke the flames of ascension!"

Volcathar (if the ritual is completed): "Fools... You have witnessed the birth of true power!"

Volcathar (when he retreats): "Pray that I sleep for a long, long time... for when I awaken, your world will be nothing but cinders!"

Volcathar (after a prisoner is thrown in the vortex): “Each sacrifice fuels the inferno, and the flames will soon consume all!”

DRAGON LAIR.name: DRAGON LAIR
DRAGON LAIR.text:
Dragon Lair

Map Notes

  1. Entrance

  2. Sacrifice Platform

  3. Prisoner Cell

  4. Caves

  5. Magma

  6. Lava

  7. Great Hallway

  8. Volcathar Hoard

If the party skip the Ritual Site and goes straight to the lair

When the party enters the lair, they find it mostly empty, with only one prisoner held captive. As they explore further, they discover murals in the Great Hallway. A successful [[/check religion 15]] check reveals the dragon’s plan to reach adulthood through a sacrificial ritual. At this point, the dragon will arrive in the lair from the ritual site in its adult form, though still weakened by the ritual. It will retain the same abilities and stats as its younger form. He needs [[/roll 1d6 + 6]] months of sleep to fully complete its transformation.

Initially, the dragon will engage in combat for a few rounds. However, having achieved his goal, he will begin to bargain with the players. He will offer a deal: he will not attack the nearby village and will retreat to sleep for an extended period if they bring him the heads of the cultists and their leader, Korvan, who tried to control him for his own ends. Just as the dragon makes his offer, Korvan and his cultists will arrive at the lair, prompting the dragon to say:

Volcathar: "The betrayers arrive just as I expected. Punish them in my name and I shall reward your deed."

If the party accepts the deal:

  • They will engage in battle against Korvan and his cultists, with the dragon observing. After Korvan is defeated, Volcathar will honor his bargain. He will retreat to his slumber, telling the party to leave immediately and warning them not to test his patience again.

If the party refuses the deal:

  • Volcathar will mockingly turn to Korvan, asking if he seeks mercy and offering him the chance to kill the party. Korvan, still believing he can control the dragon, will submit to the command.

In any situation, if Volcathar's health drops too low, he may retreat into the lava beneath his lair, vowing to return and hunt down the party once his transformation is complete.

@Embed[JournalEntry.nPkxCxmnHCKOOHMx.JournalEntryPage.k9j3yaAqiPl25ueQ caption=false cite=false]

Should the players attempt to steal from his hoard, the cavern will violently tremble, causing the lava to rise. They will have only a few minutes to escape before the lair collapses.

If the party disrupted the Ritual at Toothmaw Cliffs

At the lair, the party will find Volcathar in a foul mood, devouring the last prisoner while Korvan grovels for mercy. When the dragon sees the party intruding into his domain, his anger flares, and he orders Korvan to deal with the intruders. With his plans shattered and his pride wounded, this is the party’s best chance to defeat the dragon. If they can creatively taunt or lure him into fighting in the open, they stand a chance of slaying the young red dragon.

If the party kills Volcathar and Father Korvan, they can loot the dragon’s hoard.

If the party does not disrupted the Ritual at Toothmaw Cliffs

If the party does not disrupt the ritual, Volcathar successfully transforms into an adult dragon. However, weakened by the rapid transformation, he retreats to his lair, leaving the cultists to engage the adventurers. Korvan will also attempt to flee to the lair.

Outcome 1:

If the cult leader manages to escape, the party can follow him there.

Reaching the lair, the party will overhear a brief exchange between Korvan and the dragon:

Korvan: “You’re mine, Volcathar. With this ritual complete, you’ll serve my will. Your power will be ours to command!”

Volcathar: “Foolish mortal, you think you can chain a storm of fire? Your arrogance blinds you. Witness the true cost of defying me.”

Still deluded, Korvan believes he can control Volcathar, but the dragon, amused by the cult leader’s arrogance, mocks him before incinerating him with dragon fire.

If the party chooses to engage the dragon and wounds him too severely, he will submerge into the lava, swearing revenge once he fully recovers.

Volcathar will require [[/roll 1d6 + 6]] months of sleep to fully complete his transformation. Should the party touch his hoard, the dragon’s wrath will trigger a magical collapse of the cavern, and they will only have a few minutes to escape before being buried alive.

Outcome 2:

If Korvan does not manage to escape.

Reaching the lair, the dragon will remain hidden until they discover his hoard. Once they do, Volcathar will either engage them in battle or attempt to bargain. If he chooses to fight, his abilities remain the same as before, though his size has increased due to the ritual. Despite this, he still requires [[/roll 1d6 + 6]] months of sleep to fully complete his transformation.

If the battle turns against him and he is critically wounded, Volcathar will retreat into the lava, swearing to hunt the party until the end of time. Should the players attempt to steal from his hoard, the cavern will violently tremble, causing the lava to rise. They will have only a few minutes to escape before the lair collapses.

Hazards

@Embed[JournalEntry.yhSPsR0WME6dnI3y.JournalEntryPage.mSjonLwfmpG8LHYb caption=false cite=false]

@Embed[JournalEntry.WIO2G4gb5QLEy2q6.JournalEntryPage.fyyYTv7pKn9u7rfA caption=false cite=false]

VOLCATHAR.name: VOLCATHAR
VOLCATHAR.text:
@Embed[Actor.M77a6RMaIecEPMiq statblock classes="double-column" caption=false]{Volcathar the Flameborn}

Volcathar the Flameborn Quotes

During the Ritual Encounter:

  1. "Remember this moment of desperation as you face me again. The flames of our next encounter will be far more intense!"

  2. "What’s the matter? Are you afraid of a little heat?"

  3. "I’m here to make sure you roast slowly before the real battle begins!"

In the Lair:

  1. “Welcome to the inferno! I trust you find my domain… welcoming?”
  2. “The lava beneath your feet will be your grave.”
  3. “You will know the true meaning of suffering before I end your pitiful existence!”
  4. “Ah, the sweet aroma of burning flesh. It is a scent I intend to enjoy thoroughly.”

When Minions are Defeated:

  1. “These weaklings thought they could bring glory to my name. They die as they lived—worthless!”

When Severely Injurend or on the Defense:

  1. “You think you’ve won? I am a dragon! Your victory is but a temporary illusion!”

Before or After the Final Confruntation:

  1. “I have ruled the flames for ages, and I shall continue to do so, even if it means burning the world to cinders!”
  2. “The gods themselves fear my power. What chance do mere mortals have against me?”
  3. “You think yourselves heroes? How laughable. I will turn your valor to ashes and your ambitions to cinders.”

Taunts and Mockery:

  1. "Is that all you've got? I've roasted meat more resilient than your pathetic attempts!"
  2. “Your defiance is amusing. Let me show you why dragons are to be feared!”

When Defeated:

  1. “So, you have bested me... for now.”

Wrath of the Flameborn.name: 焚世者之怒
Wrath of the Flameborn.description:
伏尔卡萨已彻底成长为成年红龙，并陷入仇恨与复仇的狂暴。冒险者们曾阻挠其仪式的行径必将招致清算。如今，赤色巨影在诸邦肆虐——村庄化作火湖，商队成灰烬，边陲哨所仅余熔融铁骸。零星幸存者颤抖着描述恶龙可怖的焚世者之怒：巨龙总在将受害者焚为焦炭前，逼问某支冒险者小队的踪迹。

昔日蛰伏巢穴的阴影已然褪去，伏尔卡萨展开遮天双翼巡狩天际。当龙焰开始舔舐城墙垛口，恐慌如野火般在城邦间蔓延。诸邦领主向冒险者们下达最终敕令：要么终结这场浩劫，要么背负“引灾入境之罪”被永久驱逐出境。

倒计时的沙漏正在流逝——伏尔卡萨的怒火每分每秒都在膨胀，冒险者们能否在焚世者将珍视的一切化为焦土前，终结这场始于宿怨的焚世者之怒？

伏尔卡萨战吼

城镇广场奇袭：

  1. “凡人，你们以为能逃过我的追猎？这数月来的逃亡，只为此刻的焚烬！”

战术撤退：

  1. “蝼蚁的援军毫无意义...此恨未绝，天涯海角必再诛之！”
  2. “这场猎杀...远未终结！”

焚毁建筑：

  1. “尔等可听见梁柱的哀鸣？且看是屋顶先塌，还是尔等先成焦骨！”

战斗宣言：

  1. “这积郁的怒火...便由尔等血肉浇熄！”

熔岩巢穴：

  1. “熔岩将化作尔等的裹尸布！”
  2. “在赐予解脱之前...定要尔等尝尽炼狱之苦！”
  3. “血肉焦香实乃绝妙...这份愉悦，吾当细细品味”

受伤暴怒：

  1. “垂死挣扎！结局早已注定！”
  2. “痛楚...只会让龙焰愈发炽烈！”

追击宣言：

  1. “逃吧！纵使逃至天涯海角...龙焰终将再临！”

战斗嘲讽：

  1. “这便是凡人的全力？吾曾烤炙的岩蜥都比尔等顽强！”
  2. “有趣的顽抗...此刻便让尔等知晓，何谓龙怒天威！”

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: 难度调整
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
本次遭遇战的战斗难度可动态调整，其具体强度取决于以下因素：玩家角色等级、魔法物品储备、队伍规模、战场环境、敌人数量以及每个敌人的挑战等级。

本冒险模组默认针对4 名 12-15 级的玩家角色设计，但亦可调整为其他等级。

最简易的难度调节方式是修改怪物的生命值、护甲值或伤害值。

ADVENTURE SUMMARY.name: ADVENTURE SUMMARY
ADVENTURE SUMMARY.text:
Months ago, the adventurers tried to stop Volcathar, a young red dragon, from completing a dark ritual that would transform him into an adult. Though weakened by the ritual's interruption, Volcathar escaped into the molten caverns of his lair to rest and recover.

Transformed into a fearsome adult dragon, his power has fully matured, and his thirst for vengeance burns hotter than ever. Driven by hatred, the dragon has taken flight to track down the party. His only desire is to find them and burn them to ashes.

Word begins to spread that a dragon has been spotted flying across the land, leaving a trail of devastation in its wake. Villages, caravans, and outposts have been attacked, reduced to ruins. Survivors, few and traumatized, describe a monstrous red dragon with its scales covered in flames. Witnesses recount how the dragon interrogates its victims before incinerating them, demanding to know the whereabouts of a particular group of adventurers.

ADVENTURE HOOKS.name: 冒险引子
ADVENTURE HOOKS.text: 一系列聚落、贸易站与边陲哨所已被夷为平地。地方当局发现所有袭击事件均与冒险队伍存在关联——目击者证实恶龙在烈焰焚城前会指名搜寻他们的踪迹。某位担心治所将成为下个目标的地区领主，正勒令队伍立即解决这场危机，否则将以“引灾入境的罪人”之名将其驱逐。

INTRODUCTION.name: INTRODUCTION
INTRODUCTION.text: Wrath of the Flameborn is a Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition one-shot adventure designed for characters of levels 12-15. It is intended to be completed in 3-4 hours.

TOWN SQUARE.name: TOWN SQUARE
TOWN SQUARE.text:
Town Square

The town square is a bustling scene of daily life, with market stalls full of fresh produce and local merchants hawking their wares. The central fountain gently trickles, providing a calming ambiance as the party goes about their business. There is no warning, no hint of danger until it's too late.

Without warning, a shadow looms over the square. Townsfolk glance up in confusion, their faces turning to horror as the sky above them darkens with the silhouette of massive wings. A roar reverberates through the streets, shaking windows and scattering birds. Panic grips the square as people scream and flee, dropping goods and overturning carts in their desperate scramble to escape.

@Embed[JournalEntry.tzk3SwPRYH2Fc3f5.JournalEntryPage.F1EjkdCVQqEXtzQ0 caption=false cite=false]

Volcathar, consumed with rage, swoops down from the clouds. His wings create gusts of wind that scatter loose items across the square. The party, caught off guard, has only moments to react. Before they can even raise their weapons or cast their first spells, Volcathar releases a blast of fire from his maw, engulfing the nearest market stalls and setting the square ablaze.

GM Notes

The GM can use in-game tools to add burning animations to the town's buildings. You can watch our tutorial on how to do this: https://youtu.be/U1iyqmGF9RI?t=46

The smell of burning wood and flesh fills the air. Volcathar lands with a crash in the middle of the square with his eyes fixed on the party.

"Did you think you could hide from me, mortals? Now, you will burn!"

Dragon's Tactics

Surprise Attack from Above: Volcathar spots the party from the air and strikes without warning. His initial attack is a blast of flame to scatter and intimidate them, aiming to create chaos and separate the group.

Targeting Vulnerable Party Members: Volcathar focuses on party members that are out in the open first. He will aim for spellcasters or healers, seeing them as a potential threat to his power.

Flame Breath to Burn Buildings: If two or more adventurers enter a building to take cover, Volcathar will immediately shift his focus to that structure. He will unleash his breath upon the building, setting it ablaze with the intention of trapping or forcing the adventurers out. Everyone inside the building must make a [[/save dexterity 21]] saving throw with advantage, taking only half damage on a success from Volcathar Fire Breath. In [[/roll 1d4]] rounds, the building collapses.

Town Guards: If the town guard starts to gather, Volcathar may retreat to avoid an overwhelming counterattack.

If the Party Flees: If most of the party flees, Volcathar laughs cruelly.

“Flee, cowards! You can run all you want, but my flames will find you again!”

He watches them scatter before setting a final building ablaze and soaring away into the sky, leaving the town square in ruins.

LAVA FALL.name: LAVA FALL
LAVA FALL.text:
Lava Fall

This map can be used if the previous lair was destroyed by the party actions during their first encounter with Volcathar. Now, having tracked the dragon back to his domain, the adventurers find a dark, rocky plateau rising above a surrounding river of molten lava.

Furious at their daring intrusion, Volcathar prepares to make his final stand. This plateau is all that remains of his sanctuary, and seeing the adventurers invade it fills him with rage. Here, encircled by the river of lava, the dragon plans to fight to the death, determined to turn his enemies into ashes.

Hazards

Use this @UUID[Macro.9J4XeWh1XwqaTMO9]{Interactive Map Features UI} to apply damage to tokens.

VOLCATHAR.name: VOLCATHAR
VOLCATHAR.text:
@Embed[Actor.l8Pp4vS23pqWVjCK statblock classes="double-column" caption=false]{Volcathar the Flameborn}

Volcathar the Flameborn Quotes

Town Square Ambush:

  1. "Did you think you could hide from me, mortals? I have hunted you for months, and now, you will burn!"

Town Square Retreat:

  1. “I see your minions arrive, but their lives mean nothing to me. This is far from over. I will find you again!”
  2. "This is far from over. I will hunt you again."

Town Square Burning Buildings:

  1. “You think those walls will save you? Let’s see if you burn before the roof collapses!”

During the Battle:

  1. "I have waited long for this moment. Now, you will suffer as I have."

In the Lair:

  1. “The lava beneath your feet will be your grave.”
  2. “You will know the true meaning of suffering before I end your pitiful existence!”
  3. “Ah, the sweet aroma of burning flesh. It is a scent I intend to enjoy thoroughly.”

IF Wounded:

  1. "A lucky strike, but your death is inevitable!"
  2. "Pain only fuels my rage! You will regret this, mortal!"

If the Party Flees:

  1. “Flee, cowards! You can run all you want, but my flames will find you again!”

Taunts and Mockery:

  1. "Is that all you've got? I've roasted meat more resilient than your pathetic attempts!"
  2. “Your defiance is amusing. Let me show you why dragons are to be feared!”

Tower of the Broken Mind.name: 碎心之塔
Tower of the Broken Mind.description:
一座神秘高塔出现在海岸边，引发了狂风暴雨，扰乱了自然秩序。塔楼内住着其创造者破碎的灵魂残片，他失败的实验将他的个性分裂成了五个人格：学者（逻辑）、梦旅者（情感）、先知者（野心）、怯懦者（恐惧）和好奇者（好奇）。每个人格都有自己的计划，这源于创造者试图割除自身不想要的部分的失败实验。

冒险者需逐层探索这座高塔，在破解机关谜题、规避致命陷阱的过程中，必须选择出哪些人格面向值得帮助、哪些应当从实验中剔除。随着探索深入，他们将逐步揭露高塔的奥秘：包括其不稳定的虚空魔法能量、与石化蓝龙的神秘关联，以及那位法师在野心、爱情与悔恨中的挣扎。

这场冒险融合了探索、道德困境和战斗，考验着冒险者们如何平衡逻辑、情感、野心、恐惧和好奇，以揭开塔楼之谜。

Summon Voidling Elemental.description: A vortex can produce a maximum of two elementals, with no more than two elementals active per vortex at any time.

The Architect.name: The Architect
The Architect.description:
The Architect Quotes

Unstable

General Lines (Influenced by Any Aspect):

  1. "This... this isn’t right! Pieces... missing... too many cracks to hold together!"

  2. "I feel them! Pulling at me... too loud, too loud!" "Why did you do this? Why didn’t you listen? It’s broken—it’s all broken!"

Specific Influences:

  1. Scholar Influence: "Logic... fractured. Knowledge slipping through my hands! Why didn’t you fix it properly?"

  2. Visionary Influence: "You held me back! Too timid, too blind to what must be done! I could have achieved perfection!"

  3. Dreamer Influence: "Dreams... haunting me. Memories of what could have been. You should have let it go!"

  4. Curious Influence: "I can’t stop asking... what else? What could have been? Too many questions—no answers!"

  5. Coward Influence: "Fear... drowning me. Why didn’t you stop it? Why did you let this happen?"

Stable

  1. "You’ve restored me... Thank you for pulling me from the abyss."

  2. "What you’ve done here... it cannot have been easy. For that, you have my respect."

  3. "You’ve given me the chance to move forward, and for that, I am in your debt."

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 8d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

materials.value: A bit of fur and a rod of amber, crystal, or glass

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
Ray of Frost.description:
A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 1d8 cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
Ray of Frost.description: Speed is reduced by 10ft until the start of your next turn.

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot level above 1st.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

activation.condition: Which you take when you are hit by an attack or targeted by the magic missile spell

Mirror Image.name: Mirror Image
Mirror Image.description:
Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with you and mimic your actions, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real. You can use your action to dismiss the illusory duplicates.

Each time a creature targets you with an attack during the spell's duration, roll a [[/r 1d20 # Mirror Image Check]] to determine whether the attack instead targets one of your duplicates.

If you have three duplicates, you must roll a 6 or higher to change the attack's target to a duplicate. With two duplicates, you must roll an 8 or higher. With one duplicate, you must roll an 11 or higher.

A duplicate's AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier. If an attack hits a duplicate, the duplicate is destroyed. A duplicate can be destroyed only by an attack that hits it. It ignores all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.

A creature is unaffected by this spell if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with truesight.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

activation.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

Greater Invisibility.name: Greater Invisibility
Greater Invisibility.description: You or a creature you touch becomes Invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is Invisible as long as it is on the target's person.

Greater Invisibility.name: Greater Invisibility
Greater Invisibility.description: The target becomes Invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is Invisible as long as it is on the target's person.

Void Channeling.name: Void Channeling
Void Channeling.description: After the wizard casts a spell, up to two Voidling Elementals are summoned in unoccupied spaces within 10ft of him.

Stable Form.name: Stable Form
Stable Form.description: When the wizard loses all temporary HP, it will transform into its stable form.

Necrotic Pulse.name: Necrotic Pulse
Necrotic Pulse.description:
The Coward emits a wave of necrotic magic. All creatures in a 15ft radius must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. A target takes 1d10 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Note: Use this only if the Coward is left outside of the experiment.

Euphoric Embrace.name: Euphoric Embrace
Euphoric Embrace.description:
The Dreamer emits a wave of euphoria. Creatures within 15ft must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 minute. Charmed creatures see the nearest creature as a threat and attack it on their turn. They can repeat the save at the end of their turns to end the effect.

Note: Use this only if the Dreamer is left outside of the experiment.

Mental Assault.name: Mental Assault
Mental Assault.description:
The Scholar targets up to two creatures within range that it can see. Each target must succeed on a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw or be silenced for 1 minute. A silenced creature cannot speak, cast spells with verbal components, or communicate telepathically.

At the end of each of its turns, a silenced creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Note: Use this only if the Scholar is left outside of the experiment.

Motes of Force.name: Motes of Force
Motes of Force.description:
The Visionary conjures motes of force energy, targeting up to five different creatures he can see within range. Each mote hits its target automatically, dealing 2d4 + 2 force damage.

Note: Use this only if the Visionary is left outside of the experiment.

Sensory Lock.name: Sensory Lock
Sensory Lock.description:
The Curious can target one creature he can see within 30ft. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is paralyzed. The creature can repeat the save at the end of his turn to end the effect.

Note: Use this only if the Curious is left outside of the experiment.

Stormforger.name: Stormforger
Stormforger.description:
Weapon (quarterstaff), legendary (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, druid or wizard)

“Behold the power of the great storm!" the wizard shouted as the orb atop the staff began to swirl. "Feel its wrath and fear its might!" The winds howled, and bolts of lightning erupted from the staff, striking the ground and sending shock waves through the air.”

The Stormforger staff is carved from a single piece of lightning-struck wood. The staff has a glowing orb made of pure crystal at the top which pulsates with energy and contains miniature tempests within.

This staff is not meant for melee attacks but while you hold it, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged spell attack rolls and it has 10 charges. It regains 1d4 + 2 expended charges after a long rest. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 20, the staff regains 2d4 + 2 charges.

While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend its charges unleashing the following abilities using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier:

Tornado Takedown. Expending 2 charges allows you to summon a tornado that travels to a creature within 60ft. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save it takes [[/r 1d6]] bludgeoning damage and [[/r 2d6]] lightning damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. On a successful save it takes half as much damage and is not @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated}.

Aerial Ascension. Expending 5 charges you can harness the power of the tempest and summon a whirlwind beneath your feet, allowing flight for 10 minutes. The maximum altitude that can be reached while flying is 30ft.

Aerial Descent. If you are airborne after using Aerial Ascension, you can use your action to safely descend to the ground. This action does not consume any charges.

Thunderstorm of Misery. Expending 9 charges you can summoning a powerful storm around you in a 50ft radius for 1 minute. The storm creates dangerous terrain, making the ground slippery and filled with debris, making it difficult for creatures within the area of effect to move around. The winds, lightning strikes and heavy rain make it hard for creatures to see or hear, imposing disadvantage on any perception checks made while within the storm. The storm also unleashes bolts of lightning, forcing creatures within the affected area, to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they take [[/r 8d6]] lightning damage, or half as much on a successful one.

The Coward Quotes

  1. "Fear isn’t a weakness, it’s survival whispering in your ear."
  2. "Caution may seem like cowardice, but it has kept me here when others would have fallen."
  3. "They scoff at my fear, but isn’t it fear that keeps us from stepping into ruin?"
  4. "What they call hesitation, I call foresight."
  5. "Bravery is overrated. Sometimes running away is the wisest choice."
  6. "Without fear, there’s no sense of danger. Without danger, there’s no care for life."
  7. "They call me weak, but I see the risks they ignore. I see the cracks before they crumble."
  8. "The others push forward recklessly. Someone has to worry about what lies ahead."
  9. "You can call it cowardice if you like. I call it survival."

这个小瓶里装着一种绿色的液体。

饮用此药剂能彻底治愈由魔法污染和毒素（如标本室的影响）所导致的所有等级的力竭。

Arcane Shot.description:
以一个动作，你召唤出一把以太奥术弓。对范围内的一名生物发动一次远程法术攻击。若命中，目标受到 1d8 力场伤害。如果目标体型不超过中型，则其被箭矢的力量推离 10 尺。射出后弓箭随即消散。

电弧释放。每短休一次，以一个附赠动作，你可以在自身周围 5 尺半径内释放电弧。范围内的生物必须通过一次DC 14 的敏捷豁免检定。若失败，将受到 3d6 点闪电伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.ZyZMUwA2rboh4ObS]{震慑}状态直至你的下一回合开始。若成功，仅受半伤。

Cloak of Spectral Echoes v1.name: 幽影回响斗篷 v1
Cloak of Spectral Echoes v1.description:
奇物（斗篷），珍稀（需同调）

"幽影分身由意志所铸，优雅地复现我每一丝细微动作。"

幽影回响斗篷呈现为午夜蓝色的流动织物，披风上银线交织，似在现实与虚幻之间穿梭。

此披风具有 3 充能，在长休后恢复已消耗充能。

幽影回响。以一个附赠动作消耗 1 充能，可在同一位面创造幽影分身。该分身同步使用者的所有动作，令使用者攻击具有优势，且对使用者发动的攻击具有劣势。该效应持续 1 分钟或直至使用者被攻击命中。

Cloak of Spectral Echoes.name: 幽影回响斗篷
Cloak of Spectral Echoes.description:
所有攻击具有优势。

对你发动的所有攻击具有劣势

Hat of Arcane Armaments v1.name: 奥术武器帽 v1
Hat of Arcane Armaments v1.description:
奇物，极珍稀（需施法者同调）

"在战争的熔炉中，法师成为王国的活体武器，他们掌握着足以左右国家命运的力量。"

这顶奥术武器帽可让持有者施展两道法术，召唤出奥术武器。每当施展其中一道法术时，帽子会短暂地闪烁能量，将对应的武器召唤出来用于攻击，随后消失。

奥术射击（1 环法术）：

以一个动作，你召唤出一把以太奥术弓。对范围内的一名生物发动一次远程法术攻击。若命中，目标受到 1d8 力场伤害。如果目标体型不超过中型，则其被箭矢的力量推离 10 尺。射出后弓箭随即消散。

升环施法。 使用一环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，法术的伤害就增加 1d8。

心灵之火切割（1 环法术）：

以一个动作，你召唤出一把充盈灵能的以太法术剑。对触及范围内的一名目标发动一次近战法术攻击。若命中，目标受到 1d8 点心灵伤害，陷入@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.0b8N4FymGGfbZGpJ]{目盲}状态直至其下一回合结束。攻击结束后，剑随即消散。

升环施法。 使用一环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，法术的伤害就增加 1d8。

Mindflame Incision.name: 心灵之火切割
Mindflame Incision.description:
以一个动作，你召唤出一把充盈灵能的以太法术剑。对触及范围内的一名目标发动一次近战法术攻击。若命中，目标受到 1d8 点心灵伤害，陷入 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.0b8N4FymGGfbZGpJ]{目盲} 状态直至其下一回合结束。攻击结束后，剑随即消散。

升环施法。 使用一环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，法术的伤害就增加 1d8。

Blinded.name: 目盲
Blinded.description: 目盲状态来自心灵之火切割。

Rod of Lies (Rare) v1.name: 谎言权杖（珍稀）v1
Rod of Lies (Rare) v1.description:
权杖，珍稀（无需同调）

“在每个人的内心深处都有一片怀疑的空虚之地，而这根权杖能够将其唤出，让你自己的现实成为谎言。”

一根精美的黑檀木权杖，顶端镶着一颗深色的水晶球。

深度错觉。以一个动作，你可以在距离你至多 40 尺的制造一个 15 尺宽、30 尺深的地面凹陷幻象。该区域内的每名生物必须通过一次DC 15 的感知豁免检定，若失败，则“跌入”凹陷，受到 3d6 点心灵伤害，并陷入倒地状态。若成功，则无伤害，并对该效应免疫。

一旦使用，此权杖在下一次短休前将无法再次使用。

Rod of Lies (Uncommon) v1.name: 谎言权杖（非普通）v1
Rod of Lies (Uncommon) v1.description:
权杖，珍稀（无需同调）

“在每个人的内心深处都有一片怀疑的空虚之地，而这根权杖能够将其唤出，让你自己的现实成为谎言。”

一根精美的黑檀木权杖，顶端镶着一颗深色的水晶球。

深度错觉。以一个动作，你可以在距离你至多 40 尺的制造一个 10 尺宽、20 尺高的地面凹陷幻象。该区域内的每名生物必须通过一次DC 13 的感知豁免检定，若失败则“跌入”凹陷，受到 2d6 点心灵伤害，并陷入倒地状态。若成功，则无伤害，并对该效应免疫。

一旦使用，此权杖在下一次短休前将无法再次使用。

Stormforger v1.name: 风暴之铸 v1
Stormforger v1.description:
武器（长棍），传说（需术士、魔契师、德鲁伊或法师同调）

“看那狂风暴雨的威力！”法师高喊着，法杖顶端的球体开始旋转起来。“感受它的愤怒，畏惧它的力量！”狂风呼啸，一道道闪电从法杖中喷射而出，击中地面，引发阵阵冲击波在空中回荡。

风暴之铸法杖由一块被闪电击中的整木雕刻而成。法杖顶端有一个由纯水晶制成的发光球体，它随着能量的涌动而脉动，并且内部蕴含着微型的风暴。

此长棍无法用于近战攻击，当你持握长棍时，你的远程法术攻击检定获得 +2 加值。此长棍具有 10 充能，在长休后重获 1d4 + 2 次已消耗的充能。若充能耗尽，掷 d20。骰值为 20 时，长棍重获 2d4 + 2 充能。

当你持握长棍时，你可以以一个动作消耗其充能，施展以下法术，其DC和调整值均以你的法术DC和施法属性调整值为准：

龙卷风来袭。消耗 2 充能可召唤一个龙卷风，向 60 尺内的一名生物袭去。该生物必须进行敏捷豁免检定。若失败，则受到 [[/r 1d6]] 钝击伤害和 [[/r 2d6]] 闪电伤害，并陷入失能状态直至你的下一回合结束。若成功，则仅受半伤。

空中升腾。消耗 5 充能，你能够驾驭风暴之力，在脚下召唤一阵旋风，允许飞行持续 10 分钟。飞行至多高度为 30 尺。

空中下降。若使用“空中升腾”后仍处于空中，可以以一个动作安全降落至地面。此动作不消耗任何充能。

痛苦雷暴。消耗 9 充能，你可以在自身周围 50 尺半径内召唤一场强大的风暴，持续 1 分钟。风暴内区域视为困难地形，使地面变得湿滑且布满杂物，让效应区域内的生物难以移动。狂风、闪电和暴雨让生物难以看清或听清，使效应区域内的生物进行察觉检定时处于劣势。风暴将释放闪电，区域内的每名生物必须通过一次敏捷豁免检定。若失败，则受到 [[/r 8d6]] 闪电伤害，若成功则仅受半伤。

ADVENTURE SUMMARY.name: 冒险概要
ADVENTURE SUMMARY.text:
一座神秘高塔出现在海岸边，引发了狂风暴雨，扰乱了自然秩序。塔楼内住着其@UUID[Actor.7WjHNfX4PWEE1YIP]{创造者}破碎的灵魂残片，他失败的实验将他的个性分裂成了五个人格：@UUID[Actor.qkJAdaRGhEk5CSXu]{学者}（逻辑）、@UUID[Actor.fHBGmHDIeDlMG9eP]{梦旅者}（情感）、@UUID[Actor.ZOHYhK9nl6q4Nfq7]{先知者}（野心）、@UUID[Actor.5B7BWcyF2jB8peTd]{怯懦者}（恐惧）和@UUID[Actor.9XjOpzeCG7YC6lz9]{好奇者}（好奇）。每个人格都有自己的计划，这源于创造者试图割除自身不想要的部分的失败实验。

创造者进行实验的动机是为了摆脱梦旅者，这样他就能忘记他的爱情并继续他的生活。作为一名法师，他的工作被情感所干扰。因此，创造者做了他最擅长的事：一个略微疯狂的实验，以去除他性格中的那一部分。这个故事的线索在冒险中非常微妙，旨在增加一层神秘感。玩家可以通过在塔楼中找到的日记笔记和与这些人格的对话来揭示真相的片段。

冒险者需逐层探索这座高塔，在破解机关谜题、规避致命陷阱的过程中，必须选择出哪些人格面向值得帮助、哪些应当从实验中剔除。随着探索深入，他们将逐步揭露高塔的奥秘：包括其不稳定的虚空魔法能量、与石化蓝龙的神秘关联，以及那位法师在野心、爱情与悔恨中的挣扎。

这场冒险融合了探索、道德困境和战斗，考验着冒险者们如何平衡逻辑、情感、野心、恐惧和好奇，以揭开塔楼之谜。

这场冒险可以概括为三个阶段：

第一幕：入口之谜
冒险者们探索塔楼的底层，遇见了代表创造者不同性格的五个人格，并解开了入口处的球体谜题。完成谜题稳定了塔楼的奥术流动，开启了通往上层的道路。

第二幕：塔顶对决
冒险者们登上塔顶去取回实验所需的奥术能量电池，并将创造者分裂的人格重新融合。在屋顶上，他们不仅要应对环境带来的危险，还要与被不稳定能量吸引来的虚空元素展开战斗。

第三幕：实验与最终对决
在奥术法阵的房间内，冒险者们启动实验，解开光束谜题，并从最多四个人格中选择，将其在创造者的脑海中重新统一。当创造者被召唤时，被排除在外的那个人格会控制他的心智，而任何未完成其任务的人格都会变得敌对。冒险者们必须击败这些敌人，稳定创造者的状态，并决定这座塔的最终命运。

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: 难度调整
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
本次遭遇战的战斗难度可动态调整，其具体强度取决于以下因素：玩家角色等级、魔法物品储备、队伍规模、战场环境、敌人数量以及每个敌人的挑战等级。

本遭遇默认针对4 名 5-6 级的玩家角色设计，但亦可调整为其他等级。

最简易的难度调节方式是修改怪物的生命值、护甲值或伤害值。

MECHANICS.name: 机制
MECHANICS.text:
如何启用地图笔记

动画效果（可选）

若要为能力、法术和魔法物品启用动画，请安装BLFX 资源与动画编辑器高级版模组。

GM 宏指令

  • @UUID[Macro.kfOzqfjgG8VQErb5]{启用/禁用区域}

    • 该功能适用于所有地图，用于启用或禁用区域行为。例如，可通过该功能控制区域传送行为的开关状态，从而避免玩家进入特定区域时触发传送机制。对于楼梯等特定区域，保持传送行为常驻激活是必要的；而对于谜题相关区域，则建议在玩家完成解谜后激活区域行为，以符合游戏情境的逻辑性。
      由于该宏指令具有通用性，它将显示所有具有行为的区域，例如室内区域的天气抑制。

  • @UUID[Macro.pL9tL6WRxevy4dzt]{开/关光源}

    • 可用于@UUID[JournalEntry.7gwobmg96g7RltZa.JournalEntryPage.oJ2hCQwm9QjTTvaM]{-1 楼：储藏室} | @UUID[JournalEntry.7gwobmg96g7RltZa.JournalEntryPage.JuU0tRHMY9VMyqXx]{1 楼：入口} | @UUID[JournalEntry.7gwobmg96g7RltZa.JournalEntryPage.W5oyMESfEMDQf3qV]{6 楼：奥术法阵}。其功能在于便捷地控制特定场景光源的开启与关闭。

  • @UUID[Macro.aoJCylLS71Pvq3Ln]{旋转灯光}

    • 可用于@UUID[JournalEntry.7gwobmg96g7RltZa.JournalEntryPage.W5oyMESfEMDQf3qV]{6 楼：奥术法阵}。其功能在于便捷地旋转场景中的特定光源，并为实验供电（即开启所有光源）。

  • @UUID[Macro.T5uKOQfZV5fPKLUh]{召唤指示物}

    • 可用于@UUID[JournalEntry.7gwobmg96g7RltZa.JournalEntryPage.W5oyMESfEMDQf3qV]{6 楼：奥术法阵}。其功能在于将指示物召唤至场景中的预设位置。此宏会检查地图上是否已存在该角色，并且会阻止召唤相同角色的副本。需注意，若用户通过不同操作多次执行该宏指令，系统并不会记录已使用的生成位置信息。因此，当首次执行召唤第一个角色（位于初始位置）后，若再次执行该宏召唤不同角色，后续角色仍会出现在相同的初始位置。

  • @UUID[Macro.Re5IgcexE02UU6Qx]{指示物伤害}

    • 快速对选定目标施加伤害的实用工具。DC与能力字段为选填项，若留空则默认目标承受全额伤害。本宏适用于所有地图场景。

GM 笔记

  • 为防止玩家在解开特定谜题前进行传送，部分具有传送行为的区域被预设为禁用状态。
    GM可通过提供的宏指令或直接通过Foundry区域控件系统启用或禁用这些传送区域。

  • 当GM切换场景时，自定义宏会自动关闭，这是正常的。该设计旨在确保地图变更后，原对话框中的信息不再保留。

  • 若玩家攻击并消灭某个人格，该角色将从场景中永久消失，玩家将无法通过任何方式与之交互。同时，该人格也将失去参与实验的资格。

  • 请务必查阅展示材料日志获取补充信息，特别是散落在塔楼各处的法师研究笔记，其中包含重要线索。
